description:
Came here on a Thursday for a drink after work. At 5:30 pm, the place was completely packed! There was not a single seat open, and plenty of people were standing as well. I almost turned around and walked away right there and then, however we were extremely lucky as 3 spots opened at the bar (and there were 3 of us).

I got both an individual pour, as well as a flight. Comparing the beers, there were definitely some that were superior (in my mind) to others. In particular, I really enjoyed the Saison De La Vache, which is a milkshake saison. It was so creamy and delicious-- even if you don't like saisons, I would definitely recommend trying it!

The service at the bar was great, even though they were super busy. The crowd, while large, was also vibrant. It definitely seems like the place to be and a lovely spot to kick back and relax after work.
author: Angela C.

description:
Friday nite hegga loud & packed I STILL dk wth bartendress & I convo'd (but I understood woman on a date turning around to compliment my clothes heyyooo!); all I know is I walked out w a bigazz $12 can of craft beer.

F yeah.

She canned it from tap w a special empty can(!). I might've been able to get a jug or other bigger container, couldn't hear the options. Next time?
author: Dan B.

description:
Any bar that's dog-friendly earns an A+ in my book. My friend invited me to a happy hour at Black Hammer, and I was excited because I love bringing my husky puppy everywhere. In fact, we rolled up with two of his other husky friends, and it got quite crowded with a few other dogs in the bar as well.

Even though Black Hammer looks quite big, I think most of the space is taken up by the large structures actually brewing the beer. It's deceiving because there isn't actually any outdoor or back patio seating. Noted when trying to bring three huskies into a crowded bar during happy hour.

Decent selection of beer, though you have to walk up to the multiple screens hanging from the walls to determine what you want. Everything I got tasted great. Ice cold and refreshing, served up in a giant glass mug. There's pitchers too, of course. And speaking of hydration, there's a purified water bowl for the dogs in the back corner. So thoughtful.

All the bartenders are nice, and they made us feel comfortable even when the huskies wanted to play and other dogs were running rampant around the bar. Just be careful not to let any of them run out into the street. Would love to come here again, especially during a less busy hour. Happy with my experience overall!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
You know it's gonna be a good time when a fair amount of the beers on tap are above 7% abv.

I loved the variation of brews at Black Hammer. They have a small mix of lower ibu beers, then ramp it up with a few IPA's, a unique barrel-aged selection, and others. We opted to get a flight ('cause that's the best way to try em all) and favored the Lederhosen, Ten tickles, and Xtra Aun Ho the most. Not sure how often their beers rotate, but if you see these on the menu then I highly recommend.

Also tried the Hella Sexy (lager) and Go-go dancer (tripel), which were a bit less tasty as to be expected given their low ibu's. If it was the middle of the day and you wanted something light but not necessarily a lager, I'd go with the Go-go.

SOMA is up and coming with places to eat and grab a drink at whether it's after work or on a Sunday Funday, and Black Hammer should certainly be on your list!
author: Allie L.

description:
Pretty neat brewery I must say. It has a hipster/rustic feel that is small but feels spacious. Love the unique abstract artwork on the wall that was for sale. Besides have a dog running around the brewery (I am huge dog lover), their beer was great. They had a great variety of different beers and I tried several. They also serve CBD beer which I thought was cool. It's not that they were rude at all, but the bar tenders could be a little more aware of new guests walking in and maybe say hello. It was our first time there and I didn't feel like I got great service when I first walked in.

Walking distance to AT&T Park and definitely one of the better breweries in SF.
author: Chase M.

description:
One of my last stops during my most recent trip to SF was this off-the-beaten-path brewery visit. I'm still confused about BHB and PBL are related, but suffice it to say, there's enough good beer to try for anyone.

At around 4pm on a Saturday, the brewery was starting to get full, but we were able to sit near the open garage door windows. There were about 20 beers to try, and it was nice to see such a variety of types. I usually gravitate to the hoppier beers, and really liked the Sparkle Pony. My favorite, however, was the heavy-hitting Xtra An Yay Ho, which is aged in tequila barrels for 2 months - unique and boozy. There were other beers I didn't like as much, but you can't win them all. 

Vibe is definitely chill. I love the psychedelic art all over the walls. It's a nice touch to have bubbly (and still) water easily available.

Don't get the $4 pretzels. Not worth it for the price or the taste. Lots of people were ordering food to the location, however.
author: Jess L.

description:
I really really love the atmosphere and ambiance at Black Hammer. They have a very open area and lots of communal tables which makes it easy for bigger groups of friends that want to sit and drink together.

The beer selection is pretty great and they have an awesome variety of beer styles. You can make custom samplers and can sample 4 to 12 different beers. The prices are super reasonable for samplers or straight pourings of beers. I really love the new half stein glasses, they are cute. 

They often have food pop up events and live music which definitely makes Black Hammer even better. They are dog friendly and I have seen Growler running around the bar before, he is super cute. There is both sparkling or flat water available free of charge as well if you need a breather from beer. Super awesome place to grab some beers and chill.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I had Sparkle Pony, a 6.7% IPA. It was decent, which is good because the entire place smelled like BO when I was there, even with the garage doors all the way open. Cool bathrooms.
author: Bob M.

description:
Black Hammer Brewing is a cool place to come to if you work around the area or to stop by before catching the Caltrain home.  They are located on Bryant in SOMA.  

This brewery is pet friendly, home of gold, silver, and bronze beers, a BYOF ( bring your own food) establishment.  Yes I did say BYOF.  They don't have a kitchen and encourage people to bring their own food or have your food delivered.  Darwin Cafe and Garaje are nearby food options. 

They have lots of beers on tap and some change daily.  Sampling is a must with the staff being helpful and friendly.  

The ambiance is cozy with lots of seating. There are lots of electrical outlets to charge your thirsty devices and free Wifi.

Happy hour is Monday through Friday  noon to 2pm.  You get a $1 off pints and $5 off pitchers.

Black Hammer Brew is a place you should checkout.   Stay thirsty!
author: Peter C.

description: If you're a beer and board games kind of person, this place is definitely for you. It's casual but kind of trendy, and not in a super pretentious way. They have a pretty good selection and they have some games for you to choose from, if that's your thing. I'm not really sure about food but I know they serve hot pretzels--this is more of a 'for the love of drinking beer' kind of place, rather than an all-encompassing food and liquor restaurant. It's the kind of place you go to after work just to talk and have a couple drinks, especially considering that it's in an area where there are a lot of tech offices. I'd definitely go back! The chill atmosphere is absolutely a pleasure after a long day at work.
author: Claire C.

description: BHB has stepped their game up since I first came here a year ago. Their beers are freaking amazing! Definitely one of the top breweries in SF. Come check it out!
author: Michael K.

description:
On a Friday night in that area that place was pumping ! The bartender is super sweet and dances like nobody's business while he pours you your beer...oh yeah ! The beer is really reasonable priced, I was super surprised especially for that area how inexpensive the beer is. 

The ambiance is really cool with incredible art hanging on the walls and the music is pumping. Cool spot.
author: Magda G.

description:
Loved this place!! My boyfriend and I were going to a concert at the Hotel Utah Saloon right down the street and decided to come here beforehand for a drink. It's a pretty small space but they have a decent amount of seating at communal style tables.  It was a sunny afternoon and I loved how light an sunny the bar was. It looks like the open style windows are actually garage doors that they pull up when it it nice out. 

The vibe of this place was just what we were looking for. Friendly, lively, and there was live music playing which was a nice surprise. The bar is dog friendly so there were lots of pups around. They don't sell food, but a local food vendor was featured and selling empanadas in the corner. Beer was very reasonably priced and served in big steins. This will be a new go to spot for me in the area.
author: Taylor F.

description:
I came here because well, I wanted to check out some beer as well as needed to kill some time and relax while waiting for others to get done with work. So, I came here and looked at the menu, and sadly the things that I wanted to drink weren't able to be on the flight menu.

However, I still tried out the other beer. Their beers are probably on rotation, so my experience wouldn't be the same as yours probably. So, let's talk about the interior and what they offer here. They serve pretzels if you're starving and you need something in your system to keep going. They have free wifi here and is pretty great as I was able to surf the web and catch up on reviews at the same time drink my beers.

The bar is plenty spacious and there was plenty of seating. I'm thinking on a more packed night, the pickings might be slim, but overall the atmosphere here was great. The bartender was very helpful. in describing what they had on tap and listing out his recommendations. I would highly suggest this place as the atmosphere is relaxed and I had a great time.
author: Bruce K.

description: Didn't order a drink here but the vibes were alright. Closes at midnight on a Friday night :( We got there around 11 and it was already starting to empty out. They have board games in the corner (including codenames!)
author: Maggie S.

description:
Dope brewery with a nice selection of different beers. Pretty busy with the after work crowd, but was really low key. Bartender was dope and recommended a few beers, so we did a flight. Tried a classic IPA and a stout, both of which were good. The sour was too sour for my taste, but the saison was a good balance to the rest of the flight. Definitely come check this dog-friendly spot out! 

Pros:
Beer selection
Ambiance/vibe
Price

Cons:
Somewhat crowded after work
Not cleaned well - beers next to me that we're left there from previous party stayed there for the entirety of my visit
author: Vyshak C.

description: A solid four stars for the way these guys are taking care of business. Even though Black Hammer seems busy all the time, their bartenders are extremely efficient, and there's plenty of space to hang out. The bar wraps around the center of the interior, while there are couches and tables all around. Beers here are always innovative and refreshing, but I do have to say that pours are hit-or-miss, and flavor descriptors don't always match the beer you're drinking. It was nice going there once, and prices aren't outrageous for the area, but I probably wouldn't drive all the way out here to just come back.
author: Danny C.

description:
I was hanging out with Peter L for an after work happy hour. When trying to decide where to go next, I realized I've never been to Black Hammer Brewing. We stopped by on Wednesday, July 5th around 7:30pm. It was moderately busy, but we were able to grab two seats at the bar.

*Sparkle Pony: Belgian Blonde Ale, 6.9% ABV, 24 IBU, Black Hammer Brewing, San Francisco, CA ($6 pint)
*Squid Ink (Pac. Brew Lab): IPA - Black, Cascadian Dark Ale, 7% ABV, 54 IBU, Pacific Brewing Laboratory, San Francisco, CA ($7 pint)
*We're With Paris: IPA - New England Style, 7.8% ABV, 30 IBU, Black Hammer Brewing, San Francisco, CA ($6 pint)
*Sugar Free Red Bull ($4)

I started with the sparkle pony. I'm more of a Belgian White girl, so this was a nice beer. Overall, I'm not a huge beer drinker, but I was happy with my choice. Plus, I thought the name was cute. Peter got the IPAs and seemed to enjoy them. They also gave us a complimentary bowl of bar snack mix which was a nice touch as we didn't have any dinner.

Flight of 4: Black Hammer Brewing, San Francisco, CA ($20)
*Blue Me: witbier w/blueberry, 5.5% abv, 13 ibu
*Witless Zombie: witbier, 5.5% abv, 22 ibu
*Nectar of Life: kolsch, 6% abv, 24 ibu
*Dance^3: belgian tripel, 10.4% abv, 25 ibu

When I saw a couple other patrons with flights, I had to have that for my second round. I told the bartender to surprise me as you can pick any four beers you want. Based on my first round, he poured the beers above. I believe each beer was 8oz, so it's a generous serving. You're basically drinking two pints. For me, it was a nice way to try four additional beers. Especially since I'm not well versed in beers at all.

Fun HH spot. I especially like the open front on a nice day. Not sure if they have any HH specials, but I'd be down to come back and try more beers.
author: Elena N.

description:
Wow. Just wow.

Such a nice place to spend time. Bright and spacious. Board games. Beer. Fantastic.

The street facing side of the room is like a garage door that opens up when the weather is nice. Absolutely perfect.

Maybe I got lucky and walked in at just the right time, but 
they had this super chill musician playing... Think Colin Hay meets Bob Dylan. Not a concert, just live music. Tastefully in the background without being boring. Love it.

And once the musician was done they played some of my favorite bands.. What are the odds?!

And then there's the beers. I tried two of them, and what are the odds they'd be among the best beers I can remember?
And even better news: they sell those big jugs if you want some of that delicious brew to go.

I just wish I lived around here now.
author: Mattis E.

description:
Great beer and nice people. I sat at the bar with a beer and read my book and no one said, hey old man, what's wrong with you sitting at the bar reading a book? In fact, there was a younger guy sitting next to me, reading a book. What is this, a trend?

Great spot to go if you're early for your train--it's like a 6 minute walk to the station. 

If you use the bathroom, don't panic about the missing sink. It's a communal one outside the bathrooms. Now boys and girls can wash their hands together!

I can imagine that it's a much different scene if there is a Giants game happening, so check the schedule if you're not into, you know, raucous Giants fans. As a general life rule, you don't want to take public transportation with sports fans unless you are a drunken sports fan.
author: George K.

description:
Another pretty good craft brewery South of Market.  The bartender Powell was friendly and helpful.  Plenty of space at the bar and tables to spread out.  I saw a few folks working on their laptops while enjoying a beer.  They don't have much food (pretzels, etc) but you can bring stuff in to eat from outside.

I really liked their We're with Paris NE style IPA and their Something Nice American IPA.
author: Patrick H.

description:
I got the chance to check out this new brewery this past weekend and was pleasantly surprised with the place. We came around 10PM on a Saturday night so seating was pretty limited, but service was attentive and it didn't take us more than 5-10 mins to get our drink with a full house. 

The Brewery itself has awesome decor with local artist pieces lining the walls and even the walls itself. They have an open garage for part of the restaurant which definitely helps with opening up the place and adds a nice touch to the upscale feel. If you head to the back of the place you can see the barrels too! They also have group card games near the entrance so grab a game and enjoy them with your table. 

As for brews, I really enjoyed the sour they had on tap. There's no kitchen here so feel free to BYOF so you can enjoy all they have to offer on a full stomach!
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Variety of craft beer on tap and friendly atmosphere. 
I liked the surrounding art on display.
author: Diego T.

description:
They are oblivious to new guest.  There was a Giants game this night so they would be busy.  Myself and another guy sat at the bar for at least 10 min before either of the 2 bartenders ask us a question. They weren't that busy. They just literally ignored us. The bar area is small, like 10 feet wide, but neither said a word to us.
The beer was good, but they didn't seem to care if the waitress on people
author: Mark A.

description:
Was only in town for a day during a roadtrip. This place showed up on Yelp near me while walking to AT&T park. 

Great atmosphere with great beers. Small batch brews but phenomenal. I recommend getting the CBD beers if they are on tap, flavors are unreal.
author: Lorin M.

description: Largest flight in the city. It's basically like 4 full beers! One of which they offer is cannibus infused which was the first time I've seen that beer in the city. Nowhere else offers that. The atmosphere was warm and I loved their Christmas spirited poinsettia's! Next time I would definitely share the flight. I wish he would have told us it was that big!
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I came here on a first date because it's close by and well, they have sour beers on tap.

Service: The bartender was really nice and gave us suggestions based off what we had already tried and either liked or didn't like.

Beers: They have some pretty fun names for their beers (like Sparkle Pony), which of course makes me more inclined to be adventurous and try new ones. Their sour was pretty solid and they had a variety of other types if sours aren't your jam.

Ambiance: Super casual. On a Tuesday night, it was pretty empty inside, but they had the Warriors game on and about 10 other people were there hanging out.
author: Leana L.

description:
The ambience was cool and the wall art is great. The front wall folds up to open to the street which is cool but it got super cold that night (typical SF) and that made it hard to enjoy being in there.

They have mostly LIGHT beers so this place is a no-go for me. I like my beer to have flavor.
author: Roze T.

description:
This is one of my favorite breweries! I wish I lived closer because I would be here all the time! They have a wonderful selection of beer. I took one of my friends here who told me that he doesn't care for beer, and he was genuinely surprised that beer could taste this good.

I'm a huge fan of their beers, especially their IPAs, such as Dankmaster and Daft Funkier. Some of their beers are quite unique and memorable. Earlier in the year, they had a Christmas in Febrewary beer that tasted like nutmeg and was absolutely delicious. Also, they sometimes have CBD-infused beers on their menu, such as Blucid Dream and Hippie Hill. 

This brewery is dog friendly. There isn't a patio area but there's fresh air when they have the front windows open. If you're lucky, you may spot Growler, the resident brew dog. I also appreciate that they have decent amount of board games. Last time my friends and I tested our luck at Jenga, precariously stacking the pieces with our beers underneath. 

Overall, I love the vibe of this place, and I'm a huge fan of the art on the walls! It's such an awesome place to hang out with friends and enjoy a beer (or five). Also, take note, since this is in an industrial area, there's not much around but I would recommend grabbing a bite to eat from Garaje if hunger strikes.
author: Kristen P.

description:
This place is fantastic. Their hella sexy tastes like it's from Austria or Germany. Every beer we had was awesome. 

It is laid back, there are board games and lots of space, and it is dog friendly. A must visit!
author: Audrey P.

description: Loved this place! Our first time there and it was great! Great variety of beers and a pretzel to wash the beers down with! Laid back atmosphere and super friendly bartender! They've got a bunch of board games and free WiFi!
author: Jaime B.

description:
The reason I'm giving this 2 stars instead of 3 stars is because I think $20 for a 4 sample flight is too expensive. Yes they are 8 ounce pours instead of 4 ounce. But I prefer trying different beers when I visit a brewery for the first time. 

If you like sours then you can find some sour options at Black Hammer. I'm not into sours so I tried their other beers. The staff was friendly and Growler the bar dog is adorable.
author: David F.

description:
Great little breweries with a well laid out and well decorated tap room and some pretty eclectic art both painted on the walls and available for sale.  

Brain Laser and Extra Nectar were excellent.
author: Jeff D.

description:
For starters, I definitely felt like a tourist visiting Black Hammer. Or rather I was made to feel like a tourist. But for whatever that's worth, this means Black Hammer was local territory. Fine by me. Just hope everybody who walks in the door doesn't have to wait so long for a beer. At times the bartender seemed to be deliberately ignoring me, which sucked.
Saying that, the beer was definitely worth putting up with the attitude, for one trip at least. Hopefully I am not getting my breweries mixed up, but a chili beer comes to mind, and a wheat beer as well. But this place is really about the atmosphere and socializing. I'll give them another try next time as well.
author: Chris M.

description:
A great go-to bar! They have bike parking inside, which is a plus when you work in the SOMA/South Park area and want to get a drink then head home after!

The prices are great, around $6-$8 for a beer and the beer itself is super tasty! I've had so many of them that it's hard to keep track but they are definitely very good and worth stopping by for :) The bar itself is cool, with fun decor, a variety of seating, and plus it's dog friendly so feel free to bring your pup--there's a resident dog there too named Growler who's got all the tricks up his sleeve so definitely grab a puppy treat from the bar and treat him for his service ;)

Highly recommend, and will be back! It's been getting super busy the last couple of times I've gone so get there early to snack a seat or a table with friends!
author: Nerissa C.

description: Really cool brewery! Visiting the city and went over to do the Anchor Steam brewery tour (recommend that as well) in this general area of town. Noticed this spot on help, so popped in after. Really glad I did. The beers are great, and so is the staff. Did a flight and really enjoyed their beers - not standard stuff. The beers have personality but not over the top just for "beer enthusiasts." No food, but free snacks - and they have a SHIT TON of menus for places that deliver or use postmates etc. Pop in! You will enjoy the beer and have a good time!
author: Lucas E.

description:
A great little gem in the crowded FiDi/SoMa district. 

I think my favorite part of this bar is the nice vibe it's got going. Great music. Some people bring in their dogs. The bartender is friendly. They have a ton of events over the weekend. 

In terms of beer - I sampled a few and they have an interesting selection going. I'll be back here soon to sample and savor some more of their finely brewed beer. 

Also a great place to host events with your team! 

Overall: Aplus
author: Soundarya C.

description: Had 2 Sueno Verdes and enjoyed them both times :). The place is nice and chill on an early Thursday evening which I liked. Before landing here we stopped by District where everyone seemed like they were trying way too hard, and passed by Little Skillet that looked good but was a bit on the loud side. Black Hammer was the perfect tempo so settled there for a few hours and didn't regret it. Will be back
author: Neechi M.

description: The first thing that comes to mind when I think of this brewery - all the cute pups playing around. Second thought - good beers. Tried a flight since this was my first time here and opted for the porter, IPA, saison, and a sour. The sour was way too much for me, but I'm not a fan of sours in general. Loved the IPA and porter. Cool spot with a chill vibe!
author: Chandani D.

description: Cool place! Small, gets packed which gives it the real SF vibe. They have their dog which roams around just so you know. Bartenders are great and attentive. Decent beer.
author: Chriss T.

description: Really good beer. I thoroughly enjoyed the sparkle pony. The service is decent if a bit flustered. Minus one star for the truly terrible pretzels ($4 for a rock hard stale pretzel, blegh). But I'd happily come back in for the beer.
author: Lauren N.

description: Neat little spot. Right near AT&T Park. Friend service, cool and casual. Food truck outside. Good selection of craft beer. Clean bathroom. Free WiFi.
author: Steve O.

description: Definitely one of my favorite breweries in SF! They always have a good selection of different varieties of beer & they're never disappoint. I love the layout of the place, lots of tables and counter space to sit at and dog friendly. The decor of the place is probably my 2nd fav part after the beer. Street parking is pretty easy to find.
author: Bianca D.

description:
The place itself was nice. They have a big bar, a few big tables and a garage door that was open to the street on the day I came. The staff were really nice, happy to give tastes, explain everything, and placate those who came in and asked for "the lightest beer you have". Really good music on. They also do a happy hour that takes $1 off almost all the beers.
But I don't think the beer is very good. That's not a killer in itself, I think, especially in SF. Though I don't really like them, Cellarmaker down the street makes better beer. But do I want to hang out in a stuffy concrete closet with 800 other people? Not really. I would rather hang out in a comfortable place like this. And I'll probably be back here.
author: Colin G.

description:
I had been here before with some friends on a last-second ditch to hang out before we parted ways for school and had a great time. 
  On the one year anniversary, in an attempt to revisit these grand times we had, we decided to come back.  2 of us went to the bar to order some flights, and after roughly 5 minutes to even get the bartenders attention, he came over to ask what we wanted and after hearing our quick option of "bartenders choice", he immediately threw a pad of papers down and *slammed* the cup of pens down next to it.  The guy had immediately shown attitude towards us in our first interaction, then decided to ignore us for about 10-15 minutes and serve anyone and everyone around us whilst ignoring our calls for quick and easy service.  How difficult is it to pour 3 flights of whatever beers you enjoy for yourself?  If he reads this and remembers this interaction and decides to say "it was busy that night", well, it was, but why did you serve 3 other parties before deciding to even look our way again? Awful service, only thing keeping this from being a 1 star review was the chill dog roaming the venue the whole time.
author: Jesus O.

description: Max was our bartender and super nice and knowledgeable. We did the flights to sample the different wonderful beers on tap and took some to go!   Wish we could get these amazing beers in Honolulu, but we will be back when we visit SF again, fo' sho'!
author: Erika E.

description:
The bartender is really nice and patient which is great for someone who is indecisive about their beer selection. They have pitchers for $25. We got the Zombie witbier and Sparkle Pony. 

The pretzels are a little stale but still a nice touch for a bar. Really good spot to post up with friends, there was plent of space and seating.
author: Katelyn S.

description:
Low key joint off Bryant and 3rd. Great spot to wet your whistle before or after a Giants game.
Great vibe, in house beers and neat artwork.

No gimmicks, just great beer
author: Rawb D.

description:
Cool little spot on my way to AT&T park.
Staff was very friendly and great beer selection. Had light snacks like a pretzel, be cool if there was a little more food selection but I get it hard to both .
author: Giants F.

description:
Black Hammer is a solid brewhouse. They have everything you want to drink in any season of the year (like we had that many of them in San Francisco...): from wintery nitro stouts to your refreshing summer hefeweizens.

I like plenty of sitting and standing room. Too bad they don't have any outdoors seating. On the other hand the garage doors that roll up to the ceiling provide a large opening that makes it feel like you are actually outside. And I am also not entirely sure I would like to sit outdoors on a busy SoMa street. But well, patio-garden in a true biergarten fashion would be awesome. But you can't have it all!
author: Jakub S.

description:
A great place, lots of fun. We've only been twice, but we enjoyed both times thoroughly. As others have explained, it's a solid brewery. The Burning Man inspired names bring a smile to our face, as does the overall laid-back vibe.
We're dog lovers, and our last time there, a while German Shepherd mix was wandering around, on his own. He paced many laps, getting pets from everyone. I asked the beertenders about the pupper; they said he's a regular and does his own thing. That's rad.

Also, it's a short walk from AT&T Park, so that's a bonus if you're here for the Giants.
author: Erik Y.

description:
Cozy brewery in SoMa and great for game watch day!

Draft on tap and plenty of eye candies here!

Beer is of variety and Hibiscus is new and sweet!

Communal tables and a great place to gather!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Wow, talk about terrible service! Watching the line stack up while the bartenders drink beer, and then being ignored when I ask if I may try something on the menu? Uncalled for, and unprofessional. With so many breweries in the area you'd think the owners would like professional staff behind the bar. 
(Cellarmaker Brewing Company has far superior beer, and a more professional staff. If they still have it, try their Maple Bourbon Stout. Superb. )
author: Lyndi R.

description: We recently went to visit San Francisco. We wanted a nice place to go before the Giants game and this place didn't disappoint. The bar tenders are nice and knowledgeable about their beers. The brewery pup is awesome and friendly!
author: Yari M.

description: Very friendly service and a lively taproom! The beers were a bit unusual but I'm sure that's what they are going for. Had the hibiscus saison and it was good.
author: Rob R.

description: We found this place while we were doing a little brewery hopping in San Francisco! This place is huge with lots of seating inside. I fell in love with their logo on the first look itself. The bartender was a nice quiet guy who helped us with sampling some of the beers on tap. We finally settled for the Nautilus and Witless Zombie. The Nautilus is actually almost pink in color! Something you don't see often. It is a saison with a lot of different flavors like coriander, flowers but it's not sweet. It had a very unusual taste but I liked it very much. Witless Zombie on the other hand was a Belgian bitter which also tasted quite good. You can also consider this place for a date night. I think it makes a good spot for any kind of catchup.
author: Oly M.

description: Killer place, good beer. I liked their Octoberfest. Brought in my own food and had a good time. Solid 4 star beer.
author: Derek G.

description:
A quality brewery in SoMa offering selections from both the Black Hammer Brewing and Pacific Brewing Laboratory labels. 

There are a variety of styles offered here, not just the usual IPAs but also less common ones like the Smokes McGotes (smoked beer) and the Bock Party (bock). You can try several at once with a taster platter, and the bartenders here are friendly, engaging, and patient with whatever questions you might have. Added bonus: unlimited refills of snack bowls full of pretzels and peanuts.

The space has a simultaneously rustic and modern feel to it, and is a relatively compact venue tucked away on a SoMa side street. A worthy addition to the Bay Area brewing scene.
author: Vincent L.

description:
A little mixed between a 3 and a 4 on this one.  The beers are definitely unique here, most of the beers have quite a lot of flavors going on, but to some degree, I feel like less is more.  Just as a point of reference, I usually love adventurous beers that really push the boundaries.  I ended up trying the sampler here which was $20 for 4 8oz pours of your choice.  Though you may want to check the pricing as you might just want to buy as you go, depending on what you're getting.  In my flight, I did pick from a variety of types, a Tripel, a Saison, an IPA, and a Sour.  Despite loving all of these types, I'm not sure if I'd order them again.

The bar has a great vibe, and I'd come back here just for that.  It wasn't too busy when I came on a Saturday afternoon.  Though I didn't have any, they do offer some snacks at the bar which is pretty awesome too.
author: Bryson L.

description:
It's been a while since I've explored the SoMa area. After attempting to visit a new (to me) brewery on Mission only to find it was not opened, I ended up going to Black Hammer. Apparently they share a space with Pacific Brewing Labs, and between them they have a fairly extensive tap list (14 different brews). They have a really nice bar, and there was tons of space (although I was there on a Monday afternoon).

During my visit, I tried 3 of their brews (I probably should have gone for the Flight of Four):
* Witless Zombie - This is a good Belgian Witbier, although it's a little lite on the spices that I'm used to from this style.
* Deeeper Haus Stout - A really good (though quite strong) Imperial stout.
* Sunrise Set - This Berliner Weisse already has the sour flavors, no need to add lemon or orange.

There are so many microbreweries in San Francisco these days, but I'll be sure to check out Black Hammer again.
author: Ed M.

description: Luv this spot. Hospitality is great. Jim the owner is gorg... Gotta check it out for the epic style, swag and awesome brews!!!
author: Michele B.

description:
Walked into this brewery that I've been wanting to try for years to be greeted by a toddler LOL it was very awkward to be drinking right next to kids, personally I don't like to blatantly drink around kids. 

Second it is dog friendly ... no problem w that. I do have a problem w the dogs running lose and dogs being put on the tables that people eat and drink off of. The dogs butt was literally on the table that a couple was just eating on. Not to mention they give out free goldfish and do not replenish or throw out the old batch ... people were petting the dogs then eating the community bowl. I'm not a germaphobe but I guess I'm just hygienic.

Beer - lots of choices and great pricing. I got the playa pilsner which tasted like corona and bud light had a baby ... and my husband got an IPA. They do have happy hour as well and they serve half pints. They don't serve food or hard liquor and no tvs ... 

Beer was okay for what I ordered but not good enough to come back.
author: Mal L.

description:
Black Hammer is about as hipster a brewery you can get in SoMa. The beers are all puns or references to pop/nerd culture, there are usually some doggos roaming the bar, and barrels and half a tree trunk serve as tables.

Hipsterism aside, though, the beer's pretty good and it's reasonably priced. They've got a solid selection, and chances are no matter what kind of a beer drinker you are, you'll find something you like. On the other hand, nothing really blew me away, and it's a little small so finding seating for you and your friends may be tough. Overall, I like this place. I've been here four or five times before, and I'm going again tonight. Good enough for me!
author: Shawn W.

description:
If you asked me anytime before this past Friday how I feel about this place, I would have told you that I LOVE it; love taking my friends here; love the delicious beer; love the interior; love the atmosphere. 

After this Friday, I'm sad to say that I am blacklisting this place. 

My two friends and I were having a great time. We had been to Black Hammer a handful of times before and its a dependable spot for us to have some beers and chill. We had two pitchers and stuck around until closing.  As we were getting ready to leave and were finishing up our beers, a man (he had longer hair, glasses, and based on his attire it was unclear whether he was an employee or not), told us that we had to leave "right now." His tone was demanding and condescending. He forced us out and was extremely rude about it the entire time. It honestly ruined our night and we will not be returning to Black Hammer solely because of this individual who was unnecessarily rude to us, paying customers.

I've worked in food/drink service before. I know the feeling of trying to close up shop as efficiently as possible. Regardless of the situation, that level of rudeness towards your patrons is never called for.
author: Jhoana Rose J.

description:
This is not a huge place, nicely decorated and cozy. But the service is AWFUL and the beer just okay so I would not plan on going back here.

When we arrived there were I believe 3 bartenders. Soon the place was packed. I do appreciate them having snacks available for free. I went to the counter and ask if I may get a bowl. The bartender then told me to go find my own bowl since there were none behind the counter. She was the only bartender currently available, the other two seemed more interested in drinking with their friends. 

I was just taken aback by her suggestion to go find my own bowl. How about instead one of the three bartenders go around and collect empty glasses which there were piles of on several tables (including ours) from current parties and the ones sitting their previously as well as empty snack bowls. Maybe then they would have bowls available. But no...instead ask your customer to make their way to a table that are all currently full and reach through a group of people and take their bowl. That is just distasteful service...
author: Samantha S.

description:
Careful about ordering the flight hear, each is 8 oz instead of the usual 4 oz. But I very much enjoyed the beers even though I didn't actually want 32 oz of beer at the time.

I also appreciated the laid back, more modern, young vibe here. Most tap rooms have a more masculine, bear-oriented feel, but this had brighter colors and dancier music. But if you're looking for the ultra authentic brewery where the brew master owner serves beer to a couple people in a dark, earthy space, and tells you all about the hops, this is not the place for you.
author: John C.

description:
I was talking with a friend about finding new breweries in San Francisco, and found Black Hammer in SoMa tucked in next to the Bay Bridge approach on Bryant. This place is just plain cool with a decent sized bar and the requisite level of hipster style and urban décor. There are several roll-up doors and a cool half-door with the namesake "black hammer" as a handle.

Black Hammer has a very eclectic beer selection with a lot of Belgian and alternative styles. I sampled a pint of their blueberry wit before a Giants game and was pretty impressed. The place was very busy before a popular baseball game, but the service and space was not overly cramped. The beer was delicious and very reasonably priced.

This place is already popular and will probably become a regular stop while in the neighborhood for the eclectic atmosphere and beverages. Just watch out for the friendly brewery dog roaming free under the tables!
author: Kristian D.

description:
Great of beer, good staff and a dog.
Seven New England IPAs is a bit much for the west coast, but if they're good I can't complain.
Dog friendly, clean and hip.
author: Scott K.

description:
Dog friendly brewery with plenty of seating. There are outlets throughout the tap room to plug in your devices. The bartenders are friendly, quick, and accommodating.

Black Hammer offered up some familiar yet slightly experimental styles. I had the Coliandrum which was witbier with a more prevalent coriander flavor than most witbiers.
author: Joseph T.

description: Super nice staff. Wide selection of beers - maybe too wide.  It is hard to do everything well from barrel-aged stout to light, crisp kolsch.  Huge range of selection is somewhat off-putting.  Maybe it is just me.  If so, forgive the four star.
author: Tim C.

description:
While we were in the city we had some time to kill and since the weather was so crappy we decided to stay inside and do some day drinking.  It was around 330pm on Sunday and they had a Packers game on but the place was only half full which was nice.  By the time we left a while later the place started to really fill out and it was getting a little noisy inside to talk as a group.  Its a relaxed atmosphere with lots of bar seating, high top seats and also some low top seating.  The place is pet friendly and I also saw someone bring a baby.

Since a few of the beers interested us we decided to first get a flight and go on from there.  We had tried the Sparkle Pony, Hibiscus Sour, Nautilus and Bock Party.  My favorite was the Nautilus or the Hibiscus Sour, I dont quite remember but I think it was the Hibiscus Sour.  I was debating between the Sparkle Pony and another but the bartender said that was her favorite.  

Quick Tip: Ask the bartender for a bowl of nuts for free.
author: Kenneth H.

description: Great beers !!! Loved that it's dog friendly ! There's even a cute pooch that greets you . Thanks !
author: Mell R.

description: I loved all the unleashed dogs running around! My husband did not..... It looked like some others were annoyed by it too. If you don't like dogs, you might not like this place....but again, I loved it! I made so many new dog friends. The beer was pretty good too and the place had a cook vibe to it. But really, DOGS!
author: Audrey L.

description:
Very chill vibes located in SOMA. Good amount of seating (though it does get crowded on warm days and happy hour time. I love all the unique art they have hanging up. 

I like their beers, but can only say I LOVE like 2. Which I am dumb and don't remember now. But they have a nice variety of light and dark. 
Bartenders super nice.
author: Aria S.

description: I rarely explore SOMA but my friend pulled me out to BHB when she had to "work from home." BHB doesn't have a food menu but they allow outside food... so we grabbed some food at HRD nearby and brought it over. The space is great, very hip/industrial, and I absolutely loved the artwork they have here. We got a few flights to share among the 5 of us. The flights are very generous, I would say its close to 5-6oz pour each. We tried Jaded Lover, Bayvurian Lager, War Horse, Sparkle Pony, Autumn Ale, Bock Party, Hopportunistic, and Nautilus Hibuscus. All of them were pretty decent, I couldn't really pick out a favorite. It's a great place to grab some drinks with friends, play board games, or even get some work done (they have free wifi and plenty of outlets)!! I'll definitely be back the next time I need to "work from home."
author: Elaine N.

description:
Black Hammer Brewing has great beer and a great dog, so this is an easy five stars for me. I went for some afternoon rounds with my husband when we were visiting San Francisco, and hung out with Growler the entire time. He hopped in my lap as soon as I took a seat, and settled down on the adjacent stool for most of our visit. He's such an adorable, well-behaved dog. A worthy mascot for any brewery.

The place was respectably busy for a Friday at 2:30. We got prime seats at the bar, but we weren't even close to alone. We sat between two start-uppy dudes and two middle-aged dudes who had to be tourists. One of them wore a Hawaiian shirt and was absolutely tickled that there was a beer called Sex Appeal (and I think ordered it because of the name). The space was comfortable--relaxed atmosphere, cheerful decor, natural light, awesome dog. Service was friendly and immediate.

Black Hammer serves an impressive slate of house beers, and you can get them in different sized pours depending on your mood. We wanted to taste a range, so we went with the half pints. We would've done a flight, but the pricing was bizarre--it cost less to do them a la carte (though looking at the website now, it looks like they've fixed that). We tried four tasters--the War Horse, the Autumn Ale, the Bock Party, and yes, the Sex Appeal. This gave us a nice variety, and all of the beers were on point.

While we drank, I petted Growler and low key detangled a handful of matted fur on his back. It was oddly therapeutic, and he was even nicer to pet when I was done. If I lived in San Francisco, I'd go back just to hang out with that guy. Even living in LA, I hope to come back for  another visit.
author: Steph C.

description:
I work in SOMA and am often troubled by the task of finding a good, casual watering hole where a group of friends can easily meet up for a cold one after work.

Which is why we often end up at Black Hammer. It's spacious, the bartenders are friendly, they have a good number of community tables, tasty beer (and well-named...see: Sparkle Pony) and cool wall art by local artist Lauren Asta. 

AND DOG FRIENDLY! And if you don't have your own furry friend, you can enjoy giving the bar dog, Growler, a few pats! 

The front of the taproom is an enormous garage door that rolls up so it's always well-lit and airy.
author: Liina P.

description: This is one of my favorite places in SF.  The main reason is because all the outer walls open up so it feels like you are sitting on an air conditioned patio.  Pair that experience with a great selection of craft beers, a social layout, and a dog friendly atmosphere and it makes for a great spot to grab a beer with friends.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Cool little find in SoMa. I had had my eye on it for awhile now and even bookmarked Black Hammer a long time ago. It's only a short 10 minute walk from where I volunteer but I never could make myself go until recently. It was really easy to find and wasn't that bad of a walk, especially now that it's lighter out in the evening!

Seriously, what a cool little spot. There's not much else in the immediate area, but Black Hammer offers a breath of fresh air. Awesome, awesome art on the walls! Lots of cool paintings - they even smell fresh! Smelled like my old art studio - kinda gave me a headache how paint-y it smelled but I liked it lol. Just wow, so much cool art. A cool mural by the entrance too. I'm sure there's more art around the space that I missed too.

Anyway - onto the beer. I ordered two half pours: Nautilus (Hibiscus Saison) and the Sunrise Set (Berliner Weisse). Pretty good, wasn't too wowed but I still enjoyed the brews I got. There's a decent selection, so I was impressed by that mostly. I'll be back to try more of the brews.

My half pours were $5 each. A flight of 4 half pints is $20. That's more than a little pricey if you ask me. If you think about it, you're paying $20 for two (full) pints of beer...

Great place to just chill. Eclectic decor. Lots of seating and plenty of variety in seating type! Bar seating, couch-like seating at a table, high chairs, etc. I also like the open air garage setting. Would love to bring some friends here - especially my artsy ones! Tbh, I was more blown away by the art/decor than the beers. But, I'll definitely be back for both!
author: Shanise M.

description:
Passed by this place while in the AT&T Park area, and stopped in after a quick lunch by South Beach. I was drawn in by their open window format (made me feel like a beach view was imminent, even though it wasn't even by water) and chill artsy scene.

Came with a group of colleagues and enjoyed their Hopportunistic IPA, which the taptender said was extremely hoppy. She was very patient with us as we all placed our orders. They have tons of variety for seating, whether you want to be at the bar or at a communal high table, but we stuck with our loungey desk table with its comfy cushioned seats! This is a great spot for groups, and I would recommend coming here with coworkers after a hard shift or just to enjoy a good solid beer on your day off. They had a wide range of beers, but sour lovers...take a peek in here! They had only two sours here, but that's a lot more than your typical microbrewery! Only a few oyster stout and porters, but mainly a lighter beer and sour spot.

They have restrooms and just the airy-est of vibes. I dig it, and I'll definitely be back if I'm in the area. Pricing is standard, but I'm not too sure how they do on food. Most places allow outside food, but someone yelp about it when you find out. Cool spot, room for groups, and open spacious ambiance.
author: Jodi H.

description:
Full disclosure - the brewery is partially owned by a friends nephew and I told him I would stop in during my time in SF. Within walking distance of our hotel, we visited it with our local tour guide (our son, Daniel) to give it a try. 

The space is nicely laid out and there seems to be no hurry in moving you along. Located in an industrial area of SoMa, Black hammer adds something. We were there on a weekend so I don't know hat the area is like during the week (parking, traffic, etc.).

We only tried two beers - Hopportunistic and War Horse which were just okay. Not sure if we gave the place a good enough try but it is worth a return visit.
author: Dave W.

description:
Stumbled upon this brewery by chance since I was getting some work done on my car across the street. 

First impressions - unlike any brewery or taproom you've been in before. So much color, artwork all over, very creative type space. Kinda like drinking in an art gallery. I like how there's all sorts of versatile and comfortable seating. More lounge-y than Cellarmaker, I could easily come here with a large group. 

Half pints are $4 and pints are $7 but since I was there for happy hour (11am-2pm) and (9-12pm) it was a dollar off. Pitchers are $25.

Good selection on tap. I had their hibiscus saison and blueberry hefeweizen which were light and easy to drink. Matches the decor. I'll be back to check out more.
author: Earl G.

description: We went here this weekend and had a blast.  From the outside, this place looks like nothing, but we loved the laid-back atmosphere.  It was a beautiful day, and it was great to have the garage doors open.  The place was busy and had a good mix of people.  The beers were delicious and there was a good variety of brews.  Prices seemed a little high, but not being from the SF area we weren't entirely sure what would be considered high-priced.
author: Lauren M.

description:
We were really excited to come here after looking at their selections online and photos on Yelp. You may notice that of their nearly 200 photos about 40% of them are of the same thing - A beer flight. So it's safe to say this place has embraced the beer flight to the point where it is literally their flagship menu item.  Does it take a couple extra minutes to make? Probably. Is it responsible for a good portion of the revenue this places does? Also probably. 

So when we came here the Sunday before Memorial day, we weren't surpised when we saw a sea of wood planks holding four small glasses with different colored liquids in them. Nor was I surprised when the bartender took about 10 minutes to get to me because she was busy pouring said small glasses full of different beers. (Okay, I guess it was a little surprising that they only had one bartender for a full bar memorial day weekend but hey shit happens). What WAS surprising was when she finally got to me and I placed my order, which was, you guessed it - a flight of fucking beers like 90% of the bar is currently enjoying - her response was "I can't do flights anymore - it's too busy." I was literally speechless. A bartender just told me she was too busy to sell me FOUR SMALL BEERS. It was shocking on so many levels.

1) I just waited patiently while you made 3 other customers flights of beers. If you were going to institute a flight cutoff time - maybe don't do it to the person who actually waited through the flight backlog.
2) She essentially wanted me to swap four small beers with two large beers. The time savings there would have been so trivial that it boggles my mind that she allowed money to walk out the door over it.
3) Again, it's not like I asked her to muddle up some fresh mint and craft a mojito - WE ARE TALKING ABOUT 4 SMALL BEERS.

I was so tempted to order four large beers just to have her double down on her shitty logic, but frankly I didn't want to give them any money at that point. They are clearly too busy for it.
author: Georgeann G.

description: I really enjoy coming here with colleagues to grab a beer after work.  They have peanuts at every table to snack on and the tap selection is very unique.  The bartender is very helpful and nice, however sometimes I wish there was more wait staff because you can tend to wait a few minutes if you are there during peak hours.  Overall I will continue coming back for a quick yummy craft brew.
author: Jordan S.

description: Chill vibes, great brew host, and a nice selection of beer. I especially enjoyed their cream ale and their  pineapple brew with CBD.
author: Nani U.

description: Ha! The beer is decent but this place can hardly be described as a brewery -- Apparently it is suffering from an identity crisis and thinks it is a night club, judging by the loud music and DJ. Ridiculous?
author: David C.

description: Laid back on an early Saturday afternoon. Enjoyed Happy Hour until 2pm!!! Alex is great! Will be back
author: Mitchell B B.

description:
Great beers/service/location. Perfect mix of adventurous/unique and balanced/traditional brewed beers that hit the spot. The location is a great low key place to meet up with friends and catch up. There is a large table for a really large group if needed, horseshoe shaped bar area, and several smaller tables in the back next to 2 warehouse style doors that open up to the street. Big after work crowds were around when I showed up evening on a weekday.
Pro Tip: they have pub mix at the bar. 

I had the Ascendance which was recommended to me by a great Bartender working last night. That was probably my favorite paired with the pink Hibiscus Saison. Great service.
author: Michael P.

description:
Among the fresh brewery bar offerings, Black Hammer Brewing stands out among the crowd.

Tasty brews that span all beers styles--pilsner, IPA, stouts and more--so the entire gang will be happy. I also appreciate that they offer 1/2 pints, which are ideal for the designated driver. Great indoor/outdoor ambiance. Welcoming atmosphere includes charging stations under the bar. No food but we didn't mind because we went for the beer, but we were pleasantly surprised by and grateful for their complimentary bar snacks--extra kudos Black Hammer for the tasty treats! Dog friendly inside and outside, complete with toys and flowing water bowl. We look forward to making this a regular stop.
author: Sonya B.

description: Nice atmosphere and people are super friendly. But doesn't serve foods and a French pizza trunk food is working front of that. It's too pricey though
author: Benjamin J.

description:
Honestly, I'm not a huge fan of beer. So why am I at a brewery? A friend of mine was celebrating their birthday here since it was pouring rain and originally we were suppose to go to the Embarcadero ice rink. I know right? Since when did ice skating become equivalent to a beer bar.

Anyways, got there in the late afternoon on a Saturday and it was about half empty. However, that being great because it was easy to get a table. Order a sour beer and it was gooooood and like I said earlier, I'm not a huge fan of beer. They also serve flights of beer so you can taste all different ones they have. I thought it was a decent selection overall. In addition, they have free bar snacks for you to munch on, so that was quite nice. There's also a cute dog they hangs out at the bar that LOVES attention. The dog will come sit right by you or on your lab and snuggle with you. It appears it also loves the bar snacks as well. If you want to hang out with the dog, sit at the table that is closest to the bathroom. Seems to be the spot the dog likes the most.

The place does get packed though, so if you have a large party definitely come early. Only complaint about this place is that they take your empty glasses from you pretty quickly, which I get, but about half our glasses were water glasses that look exactly like the beer glasses and we were totally still drinking out of those.
author: Julie L.

description:
Wanting to grab a drink before our dinner and movie plans, Dex and I decided to check out the hot and new spot for beers at Black Hammer Brewing. The ambiance of this place is hip yet homey. Besides bar seating, there are both small and long tables (with fresh flowers) too. Place is dog friendly, so bring your pup in!

They have about 9 different beers on tap, and you can order 1/2 pint ($4-5), a pint ($6-9), or a pitcher ($25-35). Flights consist of four 1/2 pint glasses and costs $16. It's perfect to share between two people if you want to try out more beers.

Dex and I tried: Serendipitous Stout, Whipnose Imperial IPA, Oktoberfest, and the Squid Ink. They were all very enjoyable! 

HAPPY HOUR (11:30am - 2pm and 9pm until close every day)
- 1$ off pints, $5 off pitchers

They don't offer food, but you can bring outside food in. And they have huge bowls of nuts that you can snack on.

Uh oh - having this place so close to my office could be dangerous!
author: Christine S.

description: Great place to hangout And have a great beer. Family friendly place and awesome atmosphere
author: Greg S.

description: Only in town for a week, but I come here almost everyday. Music is dope, beer selection is even doper. Great for dates, but groups, working by yourself, and occasionally spotting dogs.
author: Tanmay A.

description: If I wasn't driving, I could have stayed at this brewery all day.  They have an industrial feel with a roll garage door wall.  As you walk in there is an art wall and there is interesting art all around the brewery that you can purchase.  For the beer, each is unique and it is a gift that they offer a flight to be able to try many of their styles.  When we were there, only one man was bartending and he kept up fairly well.  I tried a sample and was happy with it so just took it as a pint because like I said I had to drive :(  I ordered the War Horse, which is a Belgian IPA.  I liked that it wasn't overly bitter and had a nice balance to it.  I would love to come back and try more of their beers!
author: Stacey C.

description: Outstanding micro brewery!  Large variety of beer, something for everyone.  Very friendly & engaged staff.  Brewery mascot (Dog - "Growler") will sit on a bar stool right next to you & chill while you enjoy a pint.  I've visited more than 30 micro breweries across the USA over past 12 months & Black Hammer is the perfect fit for me, my "Go to" place when in San Francisco!
author: Rob T.

description: Great beers and nice selection.  $4 tasters are a little steep, but it's SF.  Laid back vibe and friendly bartenders.
author: Josh G.

description:
Beer was good, server's beer knowledge, not so much! This is a great place to kick it with your friends and drink some local beer! They don't serve food, so definitely don't come hungry but you're sure to enjoy their great locals brews. 

When I went to order, I told the server that I usually go for Hefeweizens and asked what he recommended, and he directed me to the Kolsch. Little did I know, they actually had a wheat beer with a hint of blueberry on tap! It was very similar to my absolute fav beer, Abita Purple Haze. I tasted my friend's and liked it a lot more than the Kolsch (understandably since I typically go for wheat beers) and he was nice enough to trade! :) 

All in all, the beer was good but I didn't find anything particularly amazing about this place. I'm not sure if I would go back the next time I am in SF.
author: Hailey P.

description: Great service. Great beer. Found this place on yelp and I wasn't disappointed. Good times with good people and that's all that matters!
author: Jerald A.

description: Great place to hang out. Counter help was amazingly helpful.
author: Mike B.

description:
What do I want out of a brewery? 

  A sizable variety of delicious beers (check)
  An inviting atmosphere (check)
  Friendly staff (check, check; yes, it deserves two checks)

Give it a try. Ask for the Jaded Raver, my favorite English bitter, worldwide.
author: Amir H.

description:
This place is awesome! The beer is tasty. The art on the walls is very interesting. The music is good and the beer is great!

It was a HOT day and they had their big front Windows open. I had the tasting flight. The bartender  (Mandy) was really nice and helpful, and knew a lot of information regarding the beer and brewery. 

I'll be back!
author: Christopher A.

description:
8-21-16
THE GOOD :
Beer done well with fun names, & fun bartenders! 

THE BAD:
seems more expensive than Seattle but I bet it's a good deal in SF

THE LOW DOWN:
just blocks from AT&T park and other mucho fun things. A good mix of solid American brews and the CDA was solid! Been there for 1 year,  so show some love and try them out.
author: Rex B.

description: Good craft beer.  Flights were pricey but it's San Fran. No food options but that's okay, keep it brew.
author: Todd A.

description:
This is the place you've been looking for.

+ any outside food allowed
+ outstanding beers (and add flavor shots to your beer if you're not a big fan already)
+ dogs allowed
+ great deep house soundtrack
+ conveniently located to ballpark, Caltrain, etc...
+ super relaxed environment

I'll be back here many times :)
author: Kerry G.

description: Very cool place. Friendly service. Nice atmosphere with the local artwork. Can't say enough about Growler. The stouts are highly recommended and I'll need to come back when the IPA w/Cannabis Essence is available.
author: J L.

description: I love everything about this establishment - excellent location near Caltrain, amazing bartenders, friendly clientele, and great beer (in great flight options!).
author: Lisa K.

description:
Great microbrewery!  Great micro brews!  Great atmosphere!  They make you feel at home even if just visiting.

They don't serve food, just peanuts.  But the welcome any outside food you bring in.  

If you're nice the bartender may even watch your dog for you while you are gone :-).
author: Kenneth K.

description: Nice looking place. Great beertender! The beers were solid for sure. Did a flight and enjoyed them.
author: Hector B.

description: Fairly new brewery just south of market near the Moscone Center.  Definitely worth a visit, but none of the beers really impressed me or were memorable enough for me to seek out again.  I liked the dog named Growler, and the workers were very friendly and welcoming.
author: Dan M.

description:
Great spot!
Pros:  
Good Beer: Enjoyed the four beers (3 good BRB and 1 "eh" PLB) we tried.   Live on tap list so you know exactly what you're options are.  Tasters are 6oz pours in sets of 4, $20.  
Nice staff: Holly (?) very friendly 
Cool spot:  we came in the afternoon and the rollups were open letting lots of light and air in.  Nice seating options and clean bathrooms.  
Free Gold Fish to snack on!  

Cons:  
?????  Parking?   We were already Park and paid up on third for something else before walking down so I'm not sure about how difficult parking is.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
My friends and I had a great time playing Cards Against Humanity here (provided by the bar!).
We sat at longitudinal stools, and it's dog friendly.
Paintings on the wall were cool, psychedelic, sparkly.
Open "windows" span the entrance, with cool square seats.
Ambience was good for a Friday night, busy, but not packed.
Beers were good, but was disappointed there wasn't a great stout to try.
author: Anmy V.

description:
I really dig the Black Hammer Brewing space, and they share this space with Pacific Brewing Laboratories which makes for a series of fun and interesting beers available all the time for tastings & drinking.

The bar is square, the walls are blue and the art is eccentric, what more could you ask for?
 
I think I generally like Pacific Brewing beers better than Black Hammer, but for hanging out and catching up with friends, this is a great spot. Solid brewery!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Lovely well-rounded brewery in SOMA with the best staff, great beers, and awesome decor. They have fast wifi if you ever want to get some work done with a beer (I never can), and plenty of room during their slower hours to catch up with friends and play a couple of board games.

Very hip and industrial space that creates a comfortable and unassuming atmosphere. Their wall is filled with unique art, and a u-shape bar provides easy of seating and ordering. Also helps that the owners are some of the quirkiest, coolest people in town. Huge fan.
author: Chen-Chen H.

description: Love this dog friendly bar in soma! After eyeing this place during my daily walks to work, I finally checked it out with my puppy. I'm not a fan of beer, but I did like the beer I drank here (the friendly bartender recommended one called passion? It was fruity and not too carbonated so it was great)! Really appreciate that this place is dog friendly because it helps my puppy with her socialization (with people and other dogs)
author: Annie S.

description:
I came here with a friend after bay to breakers to grab a couple beers before taking the caltrain home. The service was great and their selection of IPA was great as well, also just delicious. I definitely would come back to grab some beers with friends or on a date.

The inside is quaint and cute and dog friendly :) The decor is done in a hip way. We just sat at the bar, which is a nice option as well.
author: Bori B.

description: Such a great selection! Really nice staff who are knowledgable and eager to help you find the right brew for you. The beer names are clever, the decor is fun and chic, there's always interesting and beautiful art on the walls, most of the exterior wall is wide open, which gives the whole place very fresh and open and lively energy. And the music is on point! Definitely a relaxed and sexy vibe at BHB. A+, huge fan, do recommend!!
author: Emily C.

description:
Pros
Two Beer Pong tables
Plethora of board games
Free bowl of peanuts
Large Array of house made beers with size options
Cool decor
Seating is good for large groups but limited so come early 
Dog Friendly 
Outdoor Food Friendly
Outlets throughout 
Able to hang out as long as you want
Growlith (the dog)!!! 

Cons
..........

Overall Thoughts

While I don't want everyone to know about BHB, its' clear the word has gotten out and rightfully so
author: Eddie W.

description: From the moment you walk in BH feels like home. Growler, the friendly bar dog greets you and the staff is so nice/inviting. There are tons of seating options with a good size bar, high tops, and low tables that are great for groups. Oh- and bar snacks (pretzels, goldfish,peanuts) all set up at each table.The beers are great a nice variety for everyone (IPA, sour, wheat beer, porter). On a nice day the windows are open and you can bring your dog, your own food, and enjoy the scene
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Black Hammer Brewing is a little off the main drag but definitely worth seeking out.  I went there for the debut of their beer "Safety Third", brewed with yeast extracted from the playa at Burning Man.  It was excellent.  Many of their impressive selection of beers are higher abv and brewed with a bit of imagination.  They also have beer cocktails and are clearly trying to be different and innovative, so no chance of getting bored of the selection.  

The atmosphere was excellent and attracted a really good crowd.  It was extremely relaxed and friendly - although I went there on my own, I quickly got to meet new people.  They had a band later in the evening but no food other than complimentary peanuts.  There is a food truck scheduled to appear more regularly and an excellent ramen place across the street.

Staff were knowledgeable and super friendly.  I will definitely be back
author: Allan R.

description:
Overall: the high price of the beer does not equate to its quality or atmosphere. 

The location is great if you work is SOMA. It's definitely nice to have such a unique place. The beer is cold and tasty, but definitely overpriced. 

The space is neat. The art is always interesting and it's nice to have fresh air with the open windows.

It'd be perfect if they had food or if their beer was anything special. It's good, but not great.
author: Trevor B.

description: This was one of my favorite breweries that I stopped at in San Francisco. Very laid back with a hippy/hipster feel to it, open front to the street so you feel like you are sitting outside. Bartender was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about all the beer. I did not have a beer I didn't like and their squid ink IPA was unlike any beer I have tried. They do not have food here but they do encourage you to bring in food from wherever you want to. They also know the true way to my heart, with free goldfish to snack on all over the bar, made me very happy. Make sure you stop here for a few cold ones. BTW they are also dog friendly.
author: Harry P.

description: I like this place. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the beers are pretty good too! There are so many newer breweries in the area, and Black Hammer holds its own! The Squid Ink black IPA from the affiliate Pacific Brewing Laboratory is a fantastic beer. One thing that I love about this brewery is the beer names. Definitely some clever ones! Oh! The snacks! They always have bar snacks to pair with your sampler flight. Niiiiiice! I've got to tip my hat to Love and Chelsea. These two ladies do a wonderful job!
author: Alex E.

description:
My company rented out Black Hammer Brewing for a launch party and we couldn't have been happier. The staff was incredibly helpful not only with serving the beer, but even helped set up the food that we brought in from the outside caterer. 

And the venue itself is really, really cool. I love the art on the walls and the vibe in general. Has a bit of a Burner vibe to it, I suppose. 

Obviously this place is a brewery first, so it's worth noting that the beer was really terrific as well. I loved the smoked pils, IPA, and stout. Definitely got me through the night. I'm looking forward to coming back here just to relax with a cold one some day.
author: Chad R.

description:
Low key bar with great original beers.  So good that we made a poem in honor of one of the nice bartenders. 

Enriquo Enriquro, you're my hero, Una cerveza muy rico! - Rachel & Lainey
author: Lainey D.

description:
Wonderful variety of beers so everyone can find something they like.  Come for the beers, stay for the artwork around the brewery.  The hand drawn murals are stunning.  Plus the details in the craftsmanship of the tables.  I know we should talk about the beer more, but I really enjoyed the environment.  Can't wait to go back when we are in SF again.  

Say hi to Growler, the dog, if he's there.
author: Tisha N.

description:
This place serves some of the best beers I've had from a microbrewery. They have a good variety of beers that deviate from the typical west coast IPAs you traditionally see. When I was there, they had a Bock, a Blueberry Wit, and a Hibiscus Saison.

The last I saw a bock at an american microbrew? Never. And this bock was really good; it was malty strong, sweet like toffee, and medium-bodied. Wasn't expecting to like the blueberry wit, but the blueberry was a nice subtle addition to a typical wit.

Now the Vanilla Chocolate Stout: it was decent, wish it had more body. Plus I feel it would've been better if it wasn't serviced as cold as it was. It felt closer to 40º or something.

They have a ton of seating so it's great for groups. And they got a couple really cute dogs that I got to play with while enjoying my bocks :D

Felt that it was a bit on the pricey side. They have no deal for getting a flight of 4 or 5 beers. Right now if you want to try that many beers you're paying at least $20

Looking forward to checking out more brews from this pace :)
author: Andrew D.

description: I came back here for a second time. The IPA's are decent and the BA stout is good, nice bourbon flavor with hints of currants, cacao, chili's, and maple. Having said that, this beer is aged in anejo tequila barrels. I would return.
author: Rich G.

description:
::. San Francisco, California .::

My fiancé and I looked up some local breweries in San Francisco and came across Black Hammer. Nice spot, very comfortable. The service was friendly. The prices were reasonable, considering location. Their taster sets come in pairs of four for sixteen dollars, which can easily become a bit pricey if you plan on staying for a while. However, the beer is well brewed with it's own unique taste, which is what I'm looking for when trying new breweries. I loved the set up, the place has a very urban, relaxed feel to it. They have a few tables spacious enough to fit around 6-7 people. No kitchen or food service, but outside food is welcomed. They don't offer tours yet - as they're still transitioning to in-house brewing. But they are dog friendly. I recommend the Squid Ink, very rich in aroma and flavor. Great place to relax in the city.
author: Steven C.

description: I've just been here once, but I like it! Cool, chill vibe. Nice selection of brews, and for reasonably cheap prices too: ~$6 a pint, ~$25 a pitcher. The bartender was also really friendly. My friends and I came here for a few beers, and we just ended up staying for hours. Very comfortable, nice hang-out spot. There's a lot of cool art and lights around the place too. Also free peanuts!
author: Jen A.

description:
So I am not sure if I am a fan yet.  Five stars for the bartender.  He was very cool and friendly.  I think their price point may be off for flights.  It is $20 for four pours.  Depending on the type of beer you get, it can be a deal or NOT.  If you get 4 that are listed at $4 that would be $16 so they make more money.  

I liked their Belgian beer.  The other ones I tried did not "wow" me and I like a beer that I will HAVE to return for.  The space is cool.  Love the artwork.  I will be back to try other beers once they switch them out.
author: J J.

description: This is a fun stop for a unique craft beer. Try the flight sampler.  You can choose 4 4oz beers such as Daft Funk, nectar of Life, Hoportunistic. The Brewery is also dog friendly
author: sandy b.

description: Cool space, awesome beer, free pub snacks! We like it so much that we got Black Hammer/Pac Brew Labs kegs for our wedding... the only problem was that people loved it so much that we ran out of beer a day early. Beermaster Bryan is a great guy, very handsome and personable.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
There have been quite a few breweries opening in SF and I was excited to try out Black Hammer since it was just down the road from my place.  My friend and I went on a Monday for our monthly beer club and we were not disappointed.  There were not many people there but we figured that was because it was a Monday night.  The bartenders were nice and helpful.  We each got three beers.  I got the Witless Zombie, Bock Party and Sunrise Set.  My personal favorite was the Sunrise Set.

I'll definitely be coming back to try out their beer flight.
author: Blake B.

description:
Blue me. 

Adorable venue, great beers on tap, fabulous hospitality.

Stopped in here after a walk along embarcadero and it was everything I could've asked for. A fabulous tap list, a knowledgeable bartender, and a chill vibe. I got a flight of the wit, blue, saison, and 10.9% one-they were all fabulous, which is irregular since there is usually one that I'm not too keen on when I get a tasting. 

I'd check this place out if you haven't already, and to the bartender, "Sunny spot, not sure it exists anymore though."
author: Sara N.

description:
First of all, I love this area of the city.  SoMa is still kind of dark and gritty and off the radar of the bridge & tunnel and convention crowd.  You are amongst "locals" here.  And no place is more emblematic of that than Black Hammer.  It is a San Franciscan's brewery, first and foremost.  Whereas its a classy (dare I say elegant) setting for a brewery (sea-hued walls adorned with local art,  and a one-of-a-kind, stained copper bar) the crowd is vibrant and the music is a far departure from Top 40.  

The beer is really good.  As good as any local City brewery (better than some,  Magnolia, 21st Amendment ahem ahem...) and they have good snacks and the occasional food truck out front.  My favorite beer so far is the Jaded Raver; an ESB (aptly named) but I also like a lot of the collab brews they make w/ Pac Brew Labs (Squid Ink!!!).  

I've been here a few times and I find myself drifting this way more often.  So I'll see you there. Oh yeah!  Awesome fact:  they're dog friendly so bring Fido or Benji!

LS
author: Lee S.

description: Great beer and the staff is always friendly, wish they had food available but definitely not a deal breaker the price is reasonable expecially for the quality of the product. Quite and comfortable venue.
author: Billy J.

description: Came here on a Friday at 6pm and it was packed but after a short wait, we did manage to grab seats. Nice atmosphere and decor paired with good beer. The clientele is on the younger side. They are dog and kid friendly which is nice.
author: L F.

description:
Came in here on a cozy Sunday afternoon to work and chill. Everything about this place was spot on - the brews were diverse and delicious (really enjoyed their Pale Ale and Strong Blonde), the vibe was cozy and chill, and the indoor bike parking was clutch. 

I'll be back here, this may be my favorite new work & brew spot!
author: Adam Z.

description: All the beers we tried were great! My favorite was the stout. The decor was nice and staff was very attentive on a very busy day.
author: Barbara S.

description:
Great new brewery, and I'm so glad it's close to my office building! This bar isn't very big, but it has a good amount of seating and open space for people to hang out with friends.
