The bathrooms were clean and well-lit (honestly a huge bonus when at a bar). The beers weren't super expensive and they had a good variety, and the bartenders were friendly and quick!

Bonus: free wi-fi AND people can bring their dogs. I don't have any myself, but this way I get to cuddle with all the cute puppies!
author: Grace C.

description: This place is spectacular. Great beer, beautiful space. Don't miss growler, the dog. Yes, it's dog friendly.
author: william k.

description: Great beers, there is a variety of different brews so you can always find your favorite. Great vibe, beautiful art on the wall.
author: Aleyda C.

description:
It's a shame they don't serve food here but I love that you can bring anything in and enjoy it with a pint, or a half pint. I like their beer but I'd never be compelled to taste the rainbow and sample all their beers since I'm not a fan of Belgians and they have a few on tap. Still, the manager during the day is great. Super friendly BUT she does talk a little much... 

The decor is cool. The location is good from work. Definitely I will be back.
author: Tera K.

description: Great beer, terrible service. Been here probably 10 times, consistently ignored at the bar until all the male customers have been attended to, only then am I deemed worthy of the bartenders time. But when I come with the BF or male coworkers we get served right away! #lifehack Kristen/Kristin/Kristan is the worst one about this.
author: Sophia L.

description: This place was awesome, several great beers on tap including a couple sours. Really enjoyed their Stout. Free bar snacks, which were tasty and kept me there longer.
author: Matthew M.

description: We're from out of town, and we visited Black Hammer on game day. We were SO worried it was going to be overwhelmingly busy like the other bars in the area, but when we walked in, it was totally manageable! The bar has an open front with a roll up door like a garage. SO COOL. It was breezy and amazing and so much fun. The bar itself doesn't serve food, but other restaurants in the area are available for pick-up/take-out/delivery, I believe. It's kid and DOG friendly. Literally dogs are free to roam around and keep you company while you drink delicious beer and people watch. If you're not a pet lover, maybe this place isn't for you, haha. My fiance is an avid beer drinker, so this stop was for him, really. Our niece and I hung out at a roomy table while he ordered a flight of beers. A. Flight. Of. Beers. He chose 4 different 8 oz. beers, and they were severed to him in this super cool wooden beer carrier. After that, he even got to try their cannabis IPA that he says was "out of this world." Their beers have cute, fun names like Sparkle Pony and Cuddle Puddle. I could literally write about this place all day, so you should just go here if you're in the area looking for some chill atmosphere and great beer.
author: Samantha F.

description: Great tap room, I ordered a flight. All bees were good the tender gave good recommendations. My fav was sea puppy
author: Bill S.

description: A bit expensive, but nice selection of beers. Try their flight.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Great spot. This is one of the few places in SF that has free snacks. Come here to drink craft brews in a unintentionally 80s themed laid back/ fun environment. 

Great beers, friendly staff and Growler - the adorable pub dog.
author: Robert F.

description: First brewery we tried and we were not disappointed. The flights were definitely worth the money. LOVED sea puppy beer. They have games, bar snacks and very pet friendly. The bartender tonight was absolutely fantastic and so personable. This brewery is my new go to for sure!!!
author: Samara R.

description: Very impressed with this local SOMA brewery. Nice, courteous bartenders. Dog and people friendly (neither require a leash) and great beers (I had a Double, a Saison and a Sour). Definitely coming back in June for more BREW-ha-has.
author: Adam H.

description:
What's up with the low carbonation? I've only been here twice but when I got the Tangerine Dream (Imperial/Double IPA) it was almost flat and also had no hint of tangerine that I could identify. I did enjoy the nose on the Hopportunistic American Pale Ale; the flavor was a nice bold defined taste.
The other negative was the price tag - $9 for a pint? Holy moly... Don't even ask how much it is to fill their growler... 
Pups are allowed, so bring on the furry friend.
author: David H.

description:
3.5 stars.  I like the space and the open air setup - a cool place to bring your laptop and do some work.  I like the complimentary snacks (always a plus at any drinking establishment!)  I just wish the beers were better.  I tried 4 beers and thoroughly enjoyed the Nautilus hibiscus saison.  It was slightly tart, which complemented the Belgian yeast flavor, and was very refreshing.  The Squid Ink black IPA was decent but not as exciting as the name.  The Whipnose DIPA was okay, not very special.  And the Hopportunistic completely didn't live up to it's name - I didn't consider it particularly hoppy or good, to be frank.  A fellow patron was also not impressed by the blueberry wit.

I guess overall I'd give the beer 3 stars, but the general vibe 4 stars.  If I actually want good beer I'd go to City Beer or Cellarmaker instead, but if I'm looking for a chill place to do some work Black Hammer's a good option.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Great beer, really really mediocre service for me, poor for the other patrons I watched the lady bartender serving. I'd be willing to buy growlers to support the business so long as I didn't have to tip this bartender ever again. Took her 20 minutes to notice I'd sat at the bar, she was more interested in chatting with a regular, then decided to call last call at 10:20 when they close at 11... i understand wanting to get everything done in a timely manner, but when there are 15 people in your bar, I don't think calling a halt to service early will help you. 
Like I said at the beginning, great beer, I tried the sea puppy (black hammer brewing) and the nautilus (pack fix brewing laboratory) both were amazing and bade me want to explore their creations more, I'll just buy growlers to go next time. Also the design of the place was pretty awesome, loved the bar tops, and the water main style taps.
author: Bekah A.

description: Definitely a nice place to relax and have some good beer with great people. Ambience is chill , usually busy later on in the day if you go. Only complaint is seating is limited . Good selection of beers including a few sours. Overall I would come here again . Bring food as they only provide "snacks"
author: Gí T.

description: Super cool lowkey brewery in SOMA. Great beer choices I tried 2 an tripel & and IPA both great quality. Walking distance from the coin op arcade bar so a great place to start your night. Friendly staff also. Will come back when I'm in SF.
author: Van R.

description: Black hammer has one of the absolute best Ipa's I've ever had...and it's a double ipa. Totally chill atmosphere and will definitely be back again.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Low-key and relaxed vibe, friendly and knowledgeable staff, and some pretty tasty beer. Win win Black Hammer Brewing. 

I've been a fan of Pac Brew Labs since they were a tiny operation run out of a garage several blocks away so it's nice that they've found a shared home here with Black Hammer Brewing. It's the bringing together of like minds. Old faves like the squid ink black ale and hibiscus saison are on tap along with new discoveries from Black Hammer like their Oktoberfest and English ale. They don't serve food but it's real chill where you can bring your own in. I think they are primed to partner with food pop up partners and I hope that potentially happens down the road. 

Welcome addition to the neighborhood, Black Hammer Brewing is great option for post-work drinks (or lunch happy hour that they've recently started) and lazy weekend afternoons.
author: Jon L.

description: Chill and relaxing feel. Big selection and variety of craft beers and they serve pitchers!
author: Katie A.

description:
Kinda like this joint.  It looks pretty new - they still had signs up saying they were still under construction.  Overall, pretty nice place to hang out.

There wasn't too many people here when I went, but it was also the middle of the week. Ambiance is pretty nice - very hipster. Reclaimed wood everywhere, including wine barrels (which, I have to say is odd because there's no wine that I could see). The beer selection is extensive, and they've perfected the amount of seating space. Nothing too close together, but plenty of room for folks to stand/hang out. I sat at their table, which was a bit difficult to get in, as it was two L-shaped benches around a wood table...climb in it is! 

They have tiny drinks (6 oz) for $4-5, pints for $7-8, and looks like pitchers. Pretty cool, since I know a fair amount of people who like tastes of beer rather than commit to a full pint.
author: Lily W.

description: Awesome brewery. We really enjoyed being there.  Amazing staff especially Wayne the bartender,  he was really informative. We were visiting san fran and he gave us a lot of Info about the city. Really cool guy loved this place really relaxed atmosphere. The beers were great, faves were fall black, Bavarian lager, and bock party..
author: Evelyn O.

description: A quick walk inside reveals an appeal to the hipster element (understandable in SOMA) but that can be overlooked, though regrettably not this time around. My friend and I noticed the rather low carbonation and that they charge top dollar for their beer. Again, charging more $ doesn't equal bad, however, the beer just came across as flat with barely a discernible flavor. I got the Oktoberfest and was almost (not really but you know, at least surprised) shocked that for an Oktoberfest brew, it was glaringly underwhelming. I couldn't even bring myself to finish it. Eh, hit and miss as they say.
author: Frank L.

description: This place is a gem!  The beer here is simply amazing.  Especially if you're looking for something other than full on hops, which can be hard to do in this town.  They're cool with you ordering your own food in, the ambiance/decor is delightful and quirky, and they even have a resident dog (Growler) who is adorable!  A must see for anyone who likes beer, a cool place to hang out, or adorable dogs.
author: Ryan O.

description: This brewery was a total blast. The beers are good and I'm not really a beer guy. They also have games for people to play. We went on the Sunday before Valentine's Day and they had a card making station for kids in the hospital. It was really awesome. I highly recommend them.
author: Derek K.

description: Great space, but the beers were pretty mediocre. The berlinnerweise was a miss, their belgian IPA tasted very standard.. not sure what it is, but I didn't walk away very impressed by their brews.
author: Kazu O.

description: Cool spot to meetup as it's relatively low volume. The decor is definitely Playa inspired, setting is comfortable,  there are games to play, and always some dudes having an interesting conversation within ear shot. It does seem to be a tad bit of a guys hang out spot though. bonus points for tasty trail mix as a bar offering. as for the beers they were really dank and not very WOW, I personally tried the sunrise set which was a sour lemon beer and the blueberry me which didn't really taste like blueberries.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
Whether you're in a group, looking to meet other people or just feel to pass a few pints while walking your dog: that place will work.

Variety of seating option will suite any mood and beer is tasty. Noise level is average to loud.
author: Ilya K.

description: Great beers, friendly crowd, quick, attentive service. The place was extremely hot and muggy when I went, but I'll chalk that up to the wildfires at the time and them keeping the windows shut.
author: Abad M.

description:
Great venue and solid beer selection closest to AT&T Park.

Stopped here for a couple pregame brews to check it out and will definitely come back to sample more.  The taproom is nicely apportioned with multiple seating options and may be larger than I got to experience because I think they were setting up in the back for a beer pong tournament.

I don't think they have food, but there are plenty of great food options nearby.

Parking in the area isn't the easiest depending on the time of day...but where in the City is parking easy? 

Black Hammer Brewing is worth a visit.
author: Jason D.

description:
We stopped at this brewery while spending a week in San Fran. The beers were more alcoholic than most beer which I like. Even the lighter beers had a high alcohol content. 

The bartenders were wonderful and fun. I felt like home walking into this brewery except no one knew what Surly or Summit is. Bring your own snacks or order in from a local place. They have nuts to snack on at the bar too. 

Check it out if you're in the area!
author: Anna G.

description: This was an okay beer bar. Most of the beers that I found interesting weren't being poured on this visit. This place is very dog friendly, which is nice. I'll probably skip this place next time and check out other bars in the area.
author: Jason S.

description: They are the best! The Warriors just lost and we are all in mourning... BUT they bought he whole bar pizza!!! These guys care so much about their customers and I feel so loved and my tummy is so full. The beer is great and reasonably priced. It's an open air location too, so it's not stuffy at all. I'm a big fan and will definitely be back!
author: Amy C.

description:
This place is great, total cool guy-bar. Good beer, groovy art, garage doors and an excellent game selection (beer pong, are you kidding me?!). I also like the 'Buy a Friend a Drink' board, awesome idea. 

The Houston, We Have a Porter is a great dark beer (I had two) and all the others I sipped were very respectable too. Normal prices, cool atmosphere - good SoMa spot.
author: Scarlett C.

description:
Love this place ! Tyler's pretty cool and friendly
Come here to explore some great beers
author: Jaskaran U.

description: We walked here from union square and passed way too many homeless people asking for money.  The bartender is awesome and has rainbow hair! She'll let you try any of the beers before you order them.  She also let me use a phone charger because there are ports underneath the bar.  This is a cool, relaxed place where people brought their pups.  The bartender even gave the dog owners dog treats! There also is a water station with tap and sparkling water!  Finally, the beer is tasty.  I wish that they served some food though because I would have stayed longer.  She did say there were a couple places you could walk to within two blocks, but I didn't want to lose my seat at the bar
author: Shay A.

description:
Came here with my gf in March 2016. It was one of several breweries we visited while in town. And was my favorite from the ones we visited. You can bring your pets. It's got a kracken for decor!!! The female bartender was so nice and sweet. They have free bar snacks (pretzel mix). And some of the beers are really good! Definitely worth drinking at.

Here's the beers we had in March 2016 and the ratings

Witless zombie - Belgian white witbier ***|*
Blue me - blueberry wheat **|***
Sunrise set - Berliner Weiss sour *|***
Sparkle pony - Belgian blonde *|***
Whipnose imperial ipa - DIPA **|**
Jaded raver - English ale *|**
Deep haus stout - stout *|*
Squid ink - black ipa *|*

Am gonna head over there in a few hours with my girl when they open 8/11/16 and will update this review based off this current visit.
author: Angel A.

description: Good atmosphere ... Good but not outstanding beers. Can't say I hated it, but can't say I'd go out of my way to come back.
author: Stephen H.

description: Just left here and I'm pretty disappointed. Trusted our Yelp community and stopped by to grab some beer on a Sunday night with friends. The beer was pretty good but the service was the worst I've had in a long time. No real recommendations and an hour before closing told us that we had to drink the entire pitcher quickly because she was closing soon. We ordered another beer when she called last call to which she made it and yelled at us from the bar that our beer was ready. She was apparently too busy to walk it over to us when there were only two other guys in there. Tried something new today and was pretty bummed.
author: Leina K.

description:
I would recommend this place! It is a few blocks away from the Giant's Stadium (far enough though to not have as big of a crowd) and they have amazing beer! I personally prefer lighter beers, but they have great dark beers.

The service is great and it is spacious. They have a dog that is super friendly but I would not recommend this place if you are scared of dogs (they are dog friendly and quite a few people bring their dogs).
author: Umang P.

description: black hammer brewing some tasty beer i like how there flights of beer are 8oz the vibe was really chill from the worker to the customer to the location it is a nice place to meet up with friends have a few beers and get your self a good buzz going on the beer was fresh and flavorful and you can tell the brewer love his beer from the taste of the beer a great place to chill and  hang out will for sure go back next time i visit san francisco black hammer brewing a great beer drinking brewery yelp on yelper
author: sushiatown s.

description:
-Fantastic beer (especially the darker beers)
-Dog friendly
-Spacious setting 
-Great and attentive service
-The house dog is super friendly and will chill out next to you if you let him
author: Derrick W.

description: Really amazing atmosphere. Good beer, fun names and style. Interesting and eclectic art up on the walls, good music, beautiful orchids set about, and there's a doggo present sometimes that has a wonderful attitude and enjoys some love. Loving this place!
author: Chaz G.

description: Amazing atmosphere. I love nautical themes and the moment you walk through the door you are immersed into a whole new world. They used the TV Untappd menus, very interactive and helpful in choosing the right beer. Although I'm very confident in ordering my own beer by style alone, the descriptions help others with their decision. Bartenders are super friendly and helpful, I wish I had the name of the bartender that helped me, he was a gem. I love a good beer with wild yeast, so I ordered the hibiscus saison, Nautilus. Pure (Rose) gold.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Great vibe, free wifi, outlets everywhere and nice interior design.
Oh, and the beer... I love the Nautilus, which is a hibiscus saison which is tart and has a beautiful red color. And the Squid Ink is a nice and roasty, not overly hopped black IPA. And they have sparkling water on tap for when you need a break from beer drinking.
For events they have food trucks parked outside which is great because there aren't many food options around and some of those beers are strong (I think the double IPA is 10%). Great place!
author: Jenny F.

description: A variety of beers in a relaxed, friendly environment. Dog friendly. Tried the IPA & Pilsners both were balanced and tasty.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I have been looking for a brewery like this my entire west coast LIFE!! FINALLY: a place that serves a high-end-beer, with good ambience, music, class and an actual VARIETY OF BEER where NOT EVERYTHING IS LOADED WITH HOPS. 

 %^@&$#* nailed it
author: Pete S.

description: I really enjoyed this place.  We went here on a walking beer tour and the first beer we had was a hibiscus one and it was delicious.  I liked all of the beers except the pale ale but that is because I don't like pale ales.  The owners were very nice and welcoming.
author: Amanda K.

description:
The perfect spot for an after work drink, and everyone in the neighborhood knows it! My office is located *incredibly* close to BHB, so I had the privilege of trying their brews before they got super popular and crowded nearly every night of the week. Jim, the owner is one of the nicest people you'll ever meet and his dog, Growler is literally the cutest brewery accessory I've ever seen. 

My favorite brews are their Sunrise Sour (my favorite way to end the work day), while their Blue Me blueberry wit is also great as well. Both of course are on the fruitier side of the spectrum, but BHB also has a great IPAs and Ales. 

Black Hammer is probably my favorite brewery in the city, hands down!
author: Logan P.

description: Went here on Saturday with friends. Service was amazing and a great vibe. The Nautilus beer was amazing, my favorite in my flight of beers. Great value and great beers
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the owners who I've chatted with.  As for the beer, I really enjoyed the deeper IPA I had on my first visit, although it wasn't available on my most recent trip.  They have a great assortment of beers on tap and they offer half pints or flights for those who want to sample a few.

They are completely dog friendly, so bring your pup!  (For people like me who don't own dogs and rely on others to satisfy their pup-cuddling needs.)
author: Michelle K.

description: My wife and I were visiting San Francisco from the land of craft beer, San Diego, and we were looking for some tasty local brews. This place did not disappoint. Great beer, great prices, friendly staff,  beautiful brewery, and very friendly people sitting around us (thanks San Fran locals).  If you are looking for a place for a nice local craft beer, stop in!!
author: Colin Y.

description:
Great revolving beer menu, smiling friendly staff, 
comfy ambiance, dog friendly, neat artwork,

Could it be love?

It is. This place is a gem!
author: Chris W.

description: Oh man do enjoy a good pint and this place has an abundance of them. Very low key, especially on the weekends. Go to MOMA and stop off here for a beer and reflect on what you have just seen. Or just come in for a beer.
author: Art-Suzanne R.

description:
Love this bar. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and the beer is fantastic. The space is really beautiful too - turquoise and copper everywhere.

As a long time beer drinker, I've been really getting sick of the super hoppy stuff that we get on the west coast and I'm glad for simple, European style (especially German style!) beers coming out of BHB. Plus they let you have puppies around and have free snacks. Who doesn't like snacks?
author: Emily H.

description:
It's not even officially opened yet I've seen the bar packed everyday as I walk by after work. Even with the crowd, it never feels stuffy with the open garage shutter doors and high ceilings. The artwork, wood/metal artisan furnishing gives this place a nice upscale maker/artisan and eclectic vibe. 

A sign up front says dog and parrot friendly :P. The owner/brewer's dog (appropriately named Growler) is there to play with and my coworker is happy to have a bar where she can bring her well behaved Golden Retriever.

No hard liquor or mainstream brews. Just a mix of beers that the team brews up I think in the back or nearby. Light to dark, hoppy to malty, about 8-10 beers to choose from weekly. I love the saison, but seems like the blueberry wit is the popular choice this summer with the crowd.

The usb/power outlets around the bar area is a definite plus for those who need a quick phone charge or want to do some work. You can bring food in too, and with HRD just around the corner Black Hammer is a winner.
author: Sho T.

description:
Colourful, airy space with good tunes and a mellow relaxing vibe - less than 10 minutes from SF Caltrain. Plenty of seating and power points, so it's a great place 'work from home' for a couple hours. 

The street facing wall has two glass filled garage doors that are opened up during nice weather for an 'open air' feel.  In the evenings they often have a DJ playing music and the atmosphere gets more bubbling and social (there is a disco ball too!). They don't serve meals there but there are several restaurants within a block walk, and sometimes food trucks come park out front. 

It's a dog friendly venue so there are friendly visiting pets around sometimes, including the owner's sweet little brown pup. The bar has three clean spacious unisex toilets with a big sink in the hall outside.  There is a self serve water station by the bar, and they have little plates of nuts and chips to much on if you are peckish.  

My favourite beers are the Blueberry Wit and a double bock called Bock Party. Highly recommend their tasting flights to try out a few at once, and the flights are a great deal too.
author: Nat C.

description: 3.5 stars for Black Hammer Brewing. I was very excited to check it out, especially since they did such a good job with the building look & feel. Inside, however, the vibe was a bit different. The decor seemed a bit outdated/off given how sleek their logo is. The beer itself was rather disappointing. I did enjoy the Kolsch, but many of the other beers, especially the Oktoberfest and English Ale didn't have much flavor. Definitely a good neighborhood spot; I really like the indoor hanging bike rack and the large garage doors that they keep open, but not a place I will go out of my way to visit again.
author: Regina L.

description:
Really cool, off the grid place in SF. Some locals took us here and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Very laid back vibes, casual, calm, not too many people. And dogs are allowed inside which I love. I had their blueberry beer which was okay, but nothing to write home about. They had about nine others that all sounded interesting. 
Very nice owners/employees serving us. And they give you free beer nuts and tortilla chips which is awesome when you are drinking a brew. 
Seems like a great place to bring a party! 
Definitely worth a stop in!
author: Kelsey J.

description:
Tonight was a soft opening, but it was packed.  There was a DJ, a Korean food truck out front, and the people behind the bar knew what they were doing even though it was their first night. 

Of the beers, I tried the Kolsch, Oktoberfest, Sacre Bleu Blueberry Wit, and the Nautilus Hibisus Saison.  They have samplers, too.  The blueberry was light and actually had fresh blueberries in it, which was nice for summer. I think the Kolsch was my favorite. 

Bonuses:
- They had peanuts and a good toffee peanut brittle on the counter
- There's a large water dispenser, so you can help yourself to water without bugging the staff
- Even when there's a Giants game, parking isn't that bad down there at night
- There are multiple bathroom stalls
- The place was well ventilated since they have two big garage door style doors in the front

The decor is clean and modern with a slight industrial feel, but it's still very warm with cool artwork on the walls. The wood work is pretty amazing (they made their own counters and tables?).  I look forward to when they are officially open.
author: Marilyn H.

description:
As opposed to stumbling *out* of a bar, I stumbled *upon* this one.  Needed a place to camp out for a bit before an evening event, wanted internet, and searched/filtered accordingly.  Was walking to the coffee shop that was closest when I saw this place across the street on my way.  "Hmm...beer or wifi?"  The hop gods must've appreciated my choice as they rewarded me, not only with a delicious pint of brown English ale (my favorite...and priced very reasonably @ $7) - but I immediately saw on their board that they had wifi!  

Sitting here now as I write this, sipping on my delicious, cold beverage.  Got to chat w/ the owner, who was really nice...and heck, doing my good deed for the day - I let him know they need to update their Yelp page to reflect the fact that they have wifi...

Would definitely come back here - great vibe, tasteful decor - perfect place for an after-work meet up.  Also, owner has a background in...nuclear engineering??...never owned a bar or anything (although said he's been a brewer for 20+ years).  Not sure what he learned in engineering school, but he somehow learned to open and run one cool place.  Wish him success and hoping this place sticks around.
author: David M.

description: My husband loved all the beers available and totally recommend this place. Great staff who really wanted to make sure our experience was awesome! Totally recommend this place to anyone. I love the atmosphere and the fact that they used a lot of reclaimed stuff! Local artists work on the walls really made this experience one of a kind.
author: Jenny R.

description:
A wonderful beer bar through and through. 

We came through with 20 or so people last night and Black Hammer was more than happy to serve the delicious brews all evening. I highly recommend the Squid Ink IPA and the Blueberry Wit. Everything else I tried was great but those two really stood out.

The seating and tables are all beautiful, and the atmosphere is very open and inviting. Without a doubt this is on the top of my list for places to visit whenever I'm back in town.
author: Earl C.

description:
Beer comes cold and full of alcohol to numb sorrow,
Its bitterness as perfect and complete as winter in Mother Country.
Also, they have puppies.
Na zdrowie!
author: Dalyte K.

description: What a great place! Nice and open. Allows dogs. Friendly staff. Great brews. What more could you ask for?
author: Travis L.

description:
What a gem of a find! I was walking around the neighborhood, looking for a cool place to kill time till my friend's performance and I stumbled upon this jewel of a place. Everyone was so accommodating and hospitable. They didn't have any beers I was familiar with, but they provided me with a few samples before I committed to the excellent Squid Ink black IPA, which, I usually wouldn't go for, but I must admit I am a convert and now a fan. 

The decor is sleek, comfortable, inviting, and just really a pleasant atmosphere altogether. But the real seller are the people who work here - just good genuine people that want you to enjoy yourself and enjoy their product. I highly recommend this place to anyone who is in the neighborhood or just passing though San Fran like myself.
author: Ken K.

description:
Great spot to grab a beer, chat with the brewer, and enjoy an airy high-ceilinged refuge from ordinary bars.

Rotating selection and friendly, inviting staff. 

Definitely will be a staple for me when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Georgia H.

description: Brews are OK. Not amateur (didn't get off notes) but nothing to write home about. Beer seems to be designed for mainstream - nothing really offensive but nothing I'd say was great. Beertenders were friendly and helpful, but the beers didn't make it to noteworthy. I don't know if the techno rock was for the regular patrons, reflection of some German influence, or just preference for the staff. I like the idea of 4 6-8oz glasses for the flight (I don't know which they were), and $16 ain't a bad price for the volume, but nothing really jumped out as delicious. Decor is pretty cool so not a bad place to swing by if you're in the area, but I (personally) wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Don W.

description: Great place with cheap beer. $20 for a flight of 4. No food menu. Instead serves popcorn. Dogs are welcome.
author: Eric H.

description:
Great atmosphere and selection of beer. They have an open concept with an indoor/outdoor feel. Bar seating and a few tables.

Dog Friendly. Bring your pup!

Does not serve food. Beer only.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Really tasty beers! I had the Nautilus, the Sunrise Set, the Blue Me, and the Witless Zombie. All were very refreshing and enjoyable! As someone who enjoys lighter beers, I was thrilled to have so many options.
author: Lori S.

description: Checked out this spot yesterday for the first time. The space is beautiful- fun colors, lots of local artwork on the walls, and beautiful wood tables. The space has a large open front which is great for a warm Indian Summer day. They had some DJs last night and food brought in which was great. Plus for now they allow outside food which works well. The beer is a little pricey honestly- but they are going to start breeding on site so that may change. Hope they add a red ale to the list.
author: Vinitha R.

description: Excellent beers.  Their Hella Sexy is the best lager I've had in a brew pub, like a Munich October fest and with no aftertaste you often get from brewpub lagers. Their Major Hazer is a smooth and well balanced triple IPA.  Not a huge list of beers but what they have are all excellent.  Cool atmosphere, good service and good prices.
author: Gary W.

description:
I came here the other night for a get together with some friends, and was so impressed. It's such a cool space with a wonderful, welcoming vibe - plenty of seating to hang and chat, awesome artwork on the walls and a mural going up as well, and I love the garage-style doors that really opened up the room on a nice night. The bartenders were friendly, and the owner was very hands on and made sure everyone was enjoying themselves. You can tell he's very passionate about what he has created here, and with good reason - he's done a great job. I only had time to try two of the beers - the Blueberry Wit and the Jaded Raver (not gonna lie, picked that one just because I think the name is awesome). I thought they were both great, and only wish that I could have stuck around longer to try more!! My friend had a Hibiscus Saison she loved, so that's drink #1 on my next visit. 

It's dog friendly, they were showing the Giants game, and i heard they are going to start having a food truck schedule too! Especially with football season around the corner, I'm very much looking forward to making this a regular spot in my bar rotation.
author: Mary D.

description: Absolutely love this place. We went there for happy hour with a few friends and pickles( our labradoodle puppy) last night. Awesome venue, love the big airy open windows and the burner vibe.  I think it's genius that they are dog friendly... finally a cool spot that we can take our pup. Beer was great, service was also great ( super friendly staff and owner) and the best of all... Growler... he's beyond adorable.
author: Shirin O.

description: My new favorite bar in SF. Jim is a freaking amazing man. You must go here if you visit SF. Seriously, this is THE best place in the world.
author: Koby C.

description: Intimate beer bar that seems more like a private IT company party rather than a public bar. Smart crowd, lots of tech talk, free goldfish at the bar, cute bartenders and fresh beer. There is great art on the wall and if your company went public recently perhaps you can buy some. If you can't commit to one beer flavors, try the less economical yet more versatile 1/2 pint and sample as many beers as your balance will allow. I really liked the hip Hopportunistic, the English Ale (not quite English though) and the Stout to end. I definitely will return and I suggest the same to any beer lover that works or lives in ever-changing SoMa.
author: Brian J.

description: Excellent bar. Probably some of the best beer prices in SF. Nice spot to just hang out with friends and have some beers. Good music selection played as you're drinking.
author: Ariah C.

description: Not so great beer selection, awesome space which seems to be the theme for a lot of recent brew pubs in the city lately.
author: Lo F.

description:
First stop of the night for me. I chose this place because it was on a Thrillist list for places to chill with your laptop (though I didn't have mine on me). 

That had a fun little saloon door for a front door and great vibes were present as soon as I walked in. It wasn't crowded at all when I went in (Satirday at 7:30) and that's what I was looking forward to. Had a great stout ($8 for a pint). Some people ordered a sampler plate which consisted of 3 sample glasses of whichever 3 beers you'd like. I have to remember to get that next time!

Chill music playing at a moderate volume and great service earns this place 5 stars in my book.
author: David H.

description: Been coming here since they opened, sometimes hip, crowded, funky, deserted, perfect, understaffed, overstaffed, great beer...
author: Glenn S.

description: Sparkle Pony?! What?! Yes. It's as good as the name suggests. This place is awesome. Good people (and good puppy), good beer, good music and vibes; the ambiance here is so nice. This place has heart (and a pretty cool Burnermobile in the back with sparkle floors). I've made a new friend every time I've visited, too. Definitely encourage checking this place out. The local art on the walls is pretty awesome, too.
author: Zara S.

description: Visiting breweries when traveling is our favorite thing to do! We loved Black Hammer Brewing from the moment we walked in their cute door! The beers on tap were crisp and refreshing. We inquired about t-shirts and the staff was so willing to help!  It was such a fun visit.
author: Jill F.

description: Honestly the best sour I've ever had and I don't even like sours. I love this brewery. Good people, good art, good times.
author: Cecilia M.

description: Hosted an off site team building exercise at Black Hammer Brewing with my department at work. Love and the rest of the team were amazing! Great service, amazing beers, and beautiful space (plus awesome free WIFI and a friendly brewery pup!) I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a small private space with great beers on tap.
author: William P.

description: This place is amazing. Kids and dog friendly plus delicious beer! It's near the ball park so it's perfect for meeting up with fellow fans pre or post-game.
author: Ken J.

description: Yay-son was a phenomenal server. Delightful banter and pleasantly with the staff and patrons alike. Jason/ Yayson / Mitch were generous with taste tests but please don't take advantage. Stop by here with canines or friends or enemies because everyone feels welcome here.
author: Tom H.

description:
Love this place! It has a great atmosphere and its one of the only places that serves my favorite cocktail, the beers are great too.

Will definitely come back for another round.
author: Sam K.

description: Awesome brewery. I went with a flight that was picked by the bartender and loved every beer choose even the ones I typically wouldn't order. It has a nice atmosphere and garage doors that open making it the perfect place for any kind of weather
author: James S.

description: My fiancé and I both got flights. He likes IPAs. I like everything but. So we got a taste of just about every beer they have and they were all amazing. Bartender was fantastic. Atmosphere was relaxed and very artsy. In fact they have art for sale on all walls. No food to purchase, but they did have lots of goldfish!
author: Cheri E.

description: Love it!  Awesome little local place. Great beer, super friendly staff, cool venue.  No food being served, but you can bring in your own.
author: Mike D.

description: The staff is very friendly, the beers are great and the atmosphere is awesome. Couldn't ask for much more. I was really impressed with the decor and will definitely be back for more.
author: Mike W.

description: Came here after escaping the swarming chaos that is 21st Amendment. This place was chill with a good beer selection and friendly staff. Another tv visible from the bar and better prices would warranted the coveted 5-star rating.
author: Ryan C.

description: Heather is the best and most personable bar tender ever & the dogs were awesome as well! The beer was fantastic my top three favorites were sunrise set, whipnose and blue! My boyfriends favorite were jaded river and whipnose! I definitely recommend you try those place out!
author: Susy B.

description: Super new Brewery, very friendly and knowledgeable bartender! We were in town from Seattle and wanted to visit some of the local breweries and stumbled into Black Hammer. The bartender gave us a big booklet of food options in the area and gave us suggestions (even letting us bring the food back in!). Tasty beer, good music and a great atmosphere with super funky art. Happy campers
author: Kelley S.

description: An up and comming brewery with an ever changing beer menu, Black Hammer Brewery is a chill spot to check out. With really great music and gorgeous styling, it's the perfect place to relax after work with friends.
author: Stuart L.

description: Walked a while to find this place. Got a little concerned about the neighborhood. But what a find. Great ambiance. Great staff. A slightly limited selection, but at least not all 'hoppy'. Would recommend the walk from the centre.
author: Patrick T.

description: This place was a Yelp find when we were in the city and it was great! Excellent friendly service, friendly customers we socialized with, very good beer selection and easy parking.
author: Angela S.

description: This place appears to be a hidden gem! Not super busy on a Thursday night. Super clean, cool vibe, really nice place, and awesome beer! Highly recommend this place!
author: Bradley T.

description: Black Hammer Brewing is dooooooope! The hibiscus saison is just as good as everyone says, but my personal fav was the Sunrise Set (Berliner weisse). They give you snacks and there are card/board games readily available to play with your friends or neighbors. There is also really awesome art everywhere! I wish I lived closer, otherwise I'd be here every day.
author: Emily T.

description: The beer is good; a lot of mostly heavier beers like double hopped IPAs and stouts, with a few lighter offerings in a wit and hoppy saison. In their defense I was there like the third day they were open so the beer selection was limited. I did really like the half-pint offering; it's great to have more than just a taster, but not so much that I couldn't try as many as I wanted. The facilities are nice, great ambiance and the outdoor access is really nice.
author: Joel R.

description: Like the place. Being Czech, I always look very critically on beers place like this one have to offer, especially lagers. Beers here are not anything extra special but fair selection you will get. Also the food is nice, prepared in front of you. Nice experience, but bit pricey...
author: Tomas H.

description: awesome spot to hang out with friends and all! huge bowls of peanuts and pub mix available to all groups! hehe - addictive! the staff is super friendly. beers are cold and yummy - there is always a great rotating selection regardless of what type of beers you love. im always after the stouts and imperial IPAs.. totes legit spot in soma - will be back! and puppies are welcome :)
author: Christina L.

description: I visited this brewery when I was on vacation in San Francisco. The beer was varied and fantastic, and the staff was friendly. I even got to talk to the brewmaster! Also a plus: goldfish crackers were available for customers to enjoy with their beer.
author: Heather L.

description: Delicious beer, nice space. Love that you can bring kids in. I got a growler of the hibiscus saison.
author: Jessica J.

description: I really enjoyed this place. Ok, I'll be honest, the fact that they had a dog in the tasting room definitely influenced me. But that's part of the experience right? I tried their blonde sour and their red sour (Red light district) and enjoyed both. I'm more of a sour drinker and thought both were well balanced and interesting. Definitely not your run of the mill sours. Will be coming back if we're in this area again!
author: Caitlan S.

description: Very nice staff working at the bar. The beers are very well made and taste great! The bar is both clean and modern with TVs and nice countertops. There is a large selection of beer that is sure to satisfy the beer lover.
author: Joshua W.

description: They brew great beer, offer amazing service. Cool new addition to the SF beer scene.  And there is free pretzels.
author: Art S.

description: Absolutely amazing brewery, beautiful ambiance, and damn tasty brews. The music selection as well as the art scattered about on the walls is perfect and helps to focus back on the "craft" of craft beer culture, cheers and thank you! And I definitely recommend tasting the rainbow while you're there ;-P
author: Dustin D.

description: Love this place. Came here after the giants game. Did the beer tasting flight, who knew blueberry beer would be good? Definitely recommend.
author: Ed W.

description:
What a sweet, hospitable bunch of people! Loved it!! 

 I don't drink but this was the venue for a meetup and they were really nice about putting people at ease. You are allowed to bring your own food/snack and buy their drink. My husband ordered some apple juice, excellent wi-fi was a blessing so he could get his work done while I was happy chatting away with my friends.

Next morning: Dear BHB peeps, My only complaint is that my vocal cords have gone for a toss, after two hours of talking loudly, in an effort to beat the high volume music that was playing there. Just for the event room perhaps, you could turn the music low after a point. So, people can talk normally rather than scream .. scope?
author: giri s.

description: Good addition to the neighborhood.  They have wifi and random snacks at the bar.  One day they had chocolate chip cookies and the other day there was chips and salsa.  Odd, but I'm ok with it.
author: Larry L.

description: Nice beer selection. Nice relaxed atmosphere. Had the Hopportunistic ale - very good. Try this place out!
author: Richard E.

description: This place is amazing. The design, lighting, energy, and ambiance here is unpretentious and very fun. The owner is this cool guy, who knows his beer and obviously loves his job. My boyfriend loves  beer, and the owner let him sample almost a pints worth of beer that day. I don't like beer at all, but I took a few sips of the blueberry and squid ink ones, and they were good. My only suggestions would be if they could have one or two wines for non beer drinkers. Or framboise, I love that drink! They do have diet coke, and I loved that the owner didn't make me feel dumb for not liking beer. If you like beer you have to go here.
author: Lyora Z.

description: As a self descried beer snob, I am going to give this place a check plus.  Delightful variations on very much in-style beers.  Generous sized sampler, friendly staff, nice artwork, my wife even purchased a piece on display.  Looking forward to the tasking room opening.
author: Brian L.

description: The beer is solid. True to type, would be nice to see more of this in the Dallas area! Service was more reactive than proactive.
author: Boris F.

description: Amazing. The beer is amazing. Decor is amazing. Location is amazing. Staff is amazing. And ZOMG!!! The mascot doggy Growler is amazing. Nicely done Jim ;)
author: Kyra L.

description: As a dog owner in the city, I love when I find a place that allows well behaved furry friends + having a drink to go hand in hand. That being said, they are very very new and doing a great job so far with the demand..after work crowd comes in hot! Great beer, friendly staff, open space for mingling, cant wait to see what they do as they get their roots planted!
author: Danielle L.

description: Stopped by this brewery and man I was impressed. Decor was very modern and the BEER was GREAT!!!! They had a decent selection whether you like dark or light beers. For just being a couple months old I must say keep up the good work! Another plus about this brewery was our bartender Love, she was really nice and friendly and kept us smiling and happy. I'm sure she is of great benefit to this brewery. I will be back soon!!!
author: Al C.

description: Welcome our new neighbor!! Tried their Oktoberfest beer today and it was awesome!! The owner Jim said that the supply is running low so hurry in and get a taste of this delicious beer!!
author: Amber F.

description: The beer and atmosphere is amazing at black hammer. I highly recommend you try the Houston, we have a porter. Excellent flavor
author: Amanda R.

description: I recently hosted an event for the San Francisco Bar Association at Black Hammer Brewing and had approximately fifty attendees. BHB has a private room, which fit us all comfortably. The owner went the extra mile and set-up the room in a contemporary manner to suit our unique needs. The staff were both friendly and professional. We will definitely be back!
author: Sophia V.

description: I think this a pretty good brewery, I wasn't wild about the selection on draft when I visited but It changes and you can really taste the love in each sip regardless of personal taste.
author: Andrew L.

description: Very cozy, local brewery that just popped up! Highly recommend, great bartenders and feeling around the place. The beer is okay, a little bland but not bad.
author: Alexandra T.

description: Cool place allows your best friend and the beer! Still renovating I think bio really a great spot. Staff is great and the bartender very friendly. A neighborhood bar for sure. See you all there soon.
author: Jorydude r.

description: Great location, great beer, and great place to meet and relax. Beer selection is carefully crafted and delicious. I have brought several serious beer drinking friends here and they were all impressed (not with the same beer either). Jim, the owner, and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. You also have snacks to munch on and you can bring food in from outside! Why haven't you gone here yet?
author: Stephen M.

description:
Stopped by this place after work on a friday. Really liked their beers. 
Took a couple mins to find seats for 2 since the place is relatively small, hence the one less star. There is a u shaped bar with hooks to hang your bags but it seemed as though they did not have enough stools. They also had other tables you could sit at but it was pretty crammed just trying to walk around. I did like that the place was really open (it has two garage door like openings, so you get some cool air in). The dog roaming around was adorable and definitely calm.
We got a flight of 4 beers: kolsch, sunrise, boch, and hisbiscus. The kolsch tastes like any regular beer you get in Germany (trust me, I just came back from Oktoberfest). The sunrise did not taste like there was any alcohol at all. It was definitely sour and had an aftertaste of a really sour nectarine (I could feel the fuzziness in my mouth too?) The boch was mild and had a nutty aftertaste which I liked. The hibiscus was definitely different. It had a floral note to it.
Give this shot a try but big groups would definitely be hard to manage.
author: Jessica H.

description: Great place, + ambiance!  Meet new friends, good place to hang out over a beer, bring the dog &  order food from local pizza or sandwich place to eat here,, ! +5 atmosphere!!

description: What a great spot to come and enjoy a locally brewed beer after work! Cool space, friendly staff, and amazing music selection- 90's "alternative", Match Box 20 and Goo Goo Dolls. I only enjoyed one beer but will definitely be coming back for a second and third!
author: Sara B.

description: I am so happy to have this brewery in my backyard! The service is great and the beers are tasty. They have something for everyone and I cannot recommend the "Taste the Rainbow" flight enough. It is a great deal and you get to try everything they have on tap. I also love that you can bring in your own food. I would recommend Chili Lemon Garlic or Goathill Pizza. Extra bonus is that there are usually dogs. As someone who really wants a dog, but cannot in my building, I love getting my dog time in with some good beers.

description: My husband and I were killing some time before our scheduled tour of the Anchor Steam Brewery, and we just accidentally stumbled onto this small unique beer place... it has a cool decor, good beers and no kitchen, so you can bring your own food (hint hint - Goat Hill Pizza is just around the corner)... it was a perfect place to relax and play some cards.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!! Kev and Jim are fantastic. So much time, thought, and energy put into this incredible brewery. I don't drink beer often but when I do it is with Black Hammer! They even raise funds for nonprofits. Great beer great people. Go NOW!
author: M V.

description:
The beer shows an impressive range.  They have a strong showing across a wide variety of beers, so anyone can come here with a group of people and find good beer to drink.  Their hibiscus beer and blueberry beer were both excellent examples of the styles.  The Kolsch will work as a weaning beer for that guy who has to have Bud Light.  Just explain that the extra flavor is what good hot weather beer is supposed to taste like,  The pilsner was interesting with the maize flavor showing through a bit across an American (rather than Czech) pilsner tradition.
The IPA class of beers were less hop-forward than I would have expected, but given the plethora of hop-forward IPA's in the Bay Area, that is actually a nice change that gives the beer a more distinctive flavor, even though it was not in my wheelhouse.
I found the full range of beers to be of high quality and to be very drinkable.  I would advise that the tasters are 8oz, in case you make the mistake that I did and order six of them before you realize what you have done.  In case you are wondering, the signage clearly states that they are 8oz.  I just wasn't paying enough attention.
I found the staff to be pleasant and the service to be quick and attentive.  
On a Friday night the taproom looked a bit different, more like a conventional bar than a taproom, but that impression ends as soon as you start to talk about beer.  This would be a good place to bring people who don't normally want to go to a brewery as well as a place to bring beer nerds.
On the whole, I liked this place and I will come back to try the items that I skipped on the beer list the next time I have a chance.
author: Greg D.

description: As a homebrewer myself, I'm pretty particular about buying beer.  Black Hammer really hits it out of the park - even for styles I'm not a huge fan of.   The space and location are amazing.   Plan to be back many times.

description: A much needed brew spot for the area! Good atmosphere, excellent bartenders, and plenty of space for such a small spot. The vibe is solid, and inviting. Some might find it breaking the mold, but I think it's perfect for anyone looking for good beer with an amazing space, without having to fight the crowds. Again, a relatively new place, and the crowds may come, but for now this is on my list for being a regular.
